description: I love this place. Great happy hour and really good bar food. Highly recommend the pizzas and chicken strips.
author: Joey A.

description:
A fairly standard bar whose best trait is, as the name implies, a wraparound balcony offering great views of Market Street, in particular all the people-watching this entails. 

I love how the vibe here is fairly casual, as it's a bit too compact to be a dance club. Drinks, especially cocktail specials, are reasonably priced, and, overall, it's a simple, no-frills place. My pet peeve is having to pay a cover on weekends even after any special acts have ended for the evening, so if this is a sticking point for you, then beware.

Otherwise, this is quite a pleasant hangout if it's not crowded, primarily for the balcony.
author: Vincent L.

description: Great local gay bar.  Most popular on Sunday afternoons, and Friday/Saturday evenings.  Also popular during events.  Great place for drinks, people watching, and a snack.  Sometimes they charge a cover.
author: Alan H.

description:
GAAAAY!!

loved it!!

Karaoke night Monday was hella dope. I had the Rodney Special and sang my heart out. The bar service was awesome and everybody that worked there was hella nice. 

Can't wait to go back and have tons and tons and tons and tons of fun. (",)
author: Rodrigo T.

description:
The lesbian parade on the Friday of Pride weekend is what brought us here, to hopefully grab a birds eye view of it while having a few beers.  Believe it or not, it worked!  We ended up with choice seats at the corner outdoor lanai. 

ATMOSPHERE:
The bar takes up the entire second floor of a two level building at the corner of 16th & Market, right where the parade passes.  Plus, they have a cool but skinny outdoor lanai with a railing counter and bar stools that is excellent for people-watching.  The inside has some good square footage but it still can get cramped. 

The crowd was a mix.  We met all walks of life while here, including a gay-friendly drunk straight girl traveling nurse that wanted to take my gay friend and possibly me home.  :-O  Thanks anyway, sister lol. 

They have a full service bar and great music.  My Bud aluminum bottles were a mere $3 regular price, yes!

SERVICE:
Though I didn't experience it because all of my beers were purchased for me, my friends returned fairly quickly from the bar, so service was fast despite the busyness. 

FUN TIP:
Something that kept me entertained were the ding dong drivers at the intersection of Market, Noe & 16th.  Some drivers on Noe that were headed north would stop for some reason in the middle of Market, thus blocking traffic headed east on Market.  HONNNNNNNK and me SMH all afternoon long, lol!

OVERALL:
Cool vibe & views, great prices, free street entertainment.
author: Vince N.

description: How can you not love this place! Every time I have been to the Lookout I've had a great time! Drinks are good, people are friendly and you can 'lookout' from the patio area on the interesting Market St intersection.
author: Roma N.

description: Can't think of SF's famous Castro District without thinking about The LookOut! Probably my favorite bar to frequent in the Castro. Nice drinks, nice patrons, and entertaining shows!
author: Toshi P.

description: Well I recently moved to the Bay Area and my best friend was in town visiting. My boyfriend, friend and I decide to check out the Castro and go out for Halloween and to celebrate my birthday. We instantly see the lookout is packed and seems to be a good time so we decide to pay the cover, head in and order some drinks (even though the bouncer was a complete asshole.) Music was awesome and drinks were actually good and strong. We were feeling good and enjoying ourselves when this employee comes over to clear our drinks from the table and then decides to make some condescending remarks to us about "enjoying the show" and something about how we should order their new "pumpkin spice drink." We couldn't really hear the dude because it was so loud but we all felt the same vibe from him....which was get the fuck out. So we instantly decide to close out our tab and leave. I don't even know or have the words to describe how he made me feel. It was clear he didn't like the fact that we were straight and wanted us to leave. His voice literally sounded like the wicked witch of the west. I'll never go back.
author: Ashley T.

description: I don't know why i love the look out. I guess because of the outdoor area. It's really nice . You can go out with a friend and drink and catch up with a view . The staff there were nice and so were the drinks. This place has definitely a chill vibe to it if that's what you're looking for. I like how you can take someone here and actually hear their voice when you're talking to them compared to other places around the Castro. I mean if you're just tryna get down on the floor I don't think this place is what you're looking for .
author: Joshua O.

description: Nice place but they charged me $65 on drinks on my debit card even though it was $54. Please check you card statements right away as bars like these will take advantage of drunk people and charge them more. I literally have a receipt in my hand right here for $54. I'm pissed.
author: Julie N.

description:
There is nothing more sexy than a bar with management who cares. From community outreach, to the support of local performers, to fundraisers, to special causes, this bar does it all. There are categorically distinct qualities which engender loyalty to businesses, and one such quality is knowing that the business stands by its clients, maintaining a singular level of support to their brand. While this quality can be seen in the small things, it is in the business's worst moments that they have a chance to show their true colors.

I have always enjoyed The Lookout -- its staff, its view, its atmosphere, and its reinforcement of its local community. Nevertheless, I recently had an experience that tested my care for this fine establishment. The owner and management staff were excellent in their outreach and attentive in resolving my issue, and seemed to truly care about my experience. This echelon of service is how a business inspires confidence. 

The drinks, food, and almost all of the staff are fantastic. Give The Lookout a Try!
author: Michael C.

description:
I popped in here with my boys after the Santa Skivvies Run nearby, to warm up from the cold cold cold outside, and enjoy the lovely view inside!  Granted we were there at 11:00 am on a Sunday when they were packed for an event, so I can't give the best impression of the general vibe of this place under normal circumstances.  But under these festive circumstances, I had a blast!  The music was loud and completely infectious, people were wall to wall but we could still talk and order drinks in a reasonable amount of time, and all the cocktails were well made with a smile!  And though I didn't partake, they also had a really nice patio area outside overlooking the street, so this just seems like a really cool spot to enjoy drinks and probably dancing, while the city vibe rages around you.  

I had a great tipsy time, zero complaints!
author: Terri N.

description:
Review for the Lips and Lashes brunch only: 

-Food: 2 stars. Mediocre and limited, but you're not coming to this for the food.  Breakfast burrito was very bland, but not greasy.  The cinnamon rolls were stale, almost burnt.  The tatchos (tater tot nachos) were actually quite good

-Drinks: 3 stars. Anything that is premixed like the sangria or bellini with the mini Korbel bottle were VERY sweet and a little expensive.  

-Show: 4 stars. Enjoyable and energetic.  Get your $1 bills ready!

-Service: 1 star.  When we walked in, the "host" barely looked in our direction, despite being some of the first to arrive.  We couldn't figure out where we were allowed to sit or what would be optimal for the show, until he reluctantly told us.
author: Sona P.

description:
Fun 2nd story bar in the Castro. From
The Balcony on the LookOut you can see Castro  street people watch. The bartenders are sweethearts and they had a special for Jameson Cask, which has that special place in my heart. We went on a Tuesday night. It was relatively empty and a nice place to catch up with friends. Not sure what the seen is actually like on the weekend.
author: Claire G.

description: The Lookout is a fun bar, but honestly looks so much cooler from the street than it is. Once you are up there, you do have the patio to overlook market street, which is the coolest part. With that being said, the staff and setup of the bar on the inside doesn't really add anything. There are so many place to go in the Castro, and the lookout is in the middle I would say based off of quality. If You are only in SF for the night, I would check out other places, but if you are here for a while, the lookout is a decent place to visit
author: Ross S.

description:
Went there tonight with three other people and waited patiently for the bartender. I figured I'm there and that's enough of a signal for any good bartender. He was helping the group at the end of the bar that was there before me I believe so all good. Then two guys walked in and he walked right past me to serve them cause he clearly knew them so 20 minutes later we left without so much as a word from the bartender.

Considering there were maybe 10 other people total in the bar it's not surprising you guys aren't doing so well with a bartender with that attitude. Plus there were rats which I can sometimes overlook since market Street is market Street what are going to do but that attitude will not bring in customers and I will be sharing this with all my friends.
author: Rachel K.

description:
The best view on a sunny day in the area! The drinks are typically tasty. Definitely the best bathroom situation - super clean and there's at least four so there's never a long wait! 
There's a fun crowd most of the time. A great spot for visitors! Entertainment varies.
author: Chris S.

description:
My BGGF and I came here for the Lips and Lashes Brunch. It was great! We had a great time and the service was excellent. Super good vibe and the show was fantastic. 

We did split the chorizo breakfast burrito and that was also really good. I do recommend when coming to try the Korbel Peach Bellini-Rita. But even if you dont their drinks are strong and taste delicious. Very good bartenders.
author: Heather T.

description:
My boyfriend and I went on Friday night around 11 PM. It would turn out to be our worst visit. We paid $5 cover apiece to get in, and we head to the bar. I see a flyer for a cocktail named "Hurricane Bianca": Southern Comfort, pineapple juice, grapefruit juice, and bubbles. My boyfriend sees a flyer for sangria. Both cost $9.

We order our drinks, and I'm blown away by the Hurricane Bianca. Served in a tall hurricane glass with an orange wedge and a cherry, it tastes great and looks great with its citrus ombre. This beautiful cocktail saves my review from being one star.

My boyfriend, meanwhile, gets a short glass of an amber colored liquid. He tells me it tastes strongly of cinnamon. I try some, and I'm forced to agree. It tastes remarkably one-note. He goes up to the bar to ask how they make it.

At this point I should inform you that I've made sangria myself. I used a big glass dispenser where i soaked a couple cups of diced apples and oranges in a bottle of white wine mixed with some club soda and a little bit of apple brandy. It tasted pretty good. People liked it.

My boyfriend comes back. The bartender told him that the sangria was one half white wine and one half Fireball Cinnamon Whiskey.

Now, Fireball sangria exists, and--though I haven't tried to make it--I don't think it would taste like the awful swill we paid $9 for. This is not a cocktail you or I would knowingly order, and The Lookout should be ashamed to sell us a drink that is clearly not sangria and tell us it is.

White wine and Fireball do not make sangria. The Lookout charged us $5 cover and $9 for cocktails. The Hurricane Bianca was a knockout. The sangria was disgusting, fraudulent backwash.
author: Robert F.

description: Some Spot....Met my Husband here, he was a naked drag act...That sort of thing gets me going!!
author: Aideen O.

description:
I've always passed this bar and I recently just went there with a friend to check it out. I saw that they had Happy Hour and I got a margarita for $5 and it was strong. It wasn't too crowded when we went so there was a lot of breathing room. We went outside the balcony and it had a great view of the street, hence the name.

I'd love to come back here again during Happy Hour for sure.
author: Aj C.

description:
I've definitely had better. Maybe, it was the bartenders or maybe it was bad luck on multipliable  nights. But, whatever the reason EVERY time I go there.  I either get no service or HORRIBLE service (non-tentative/slow bartenders). I'm a bartender so I can understand how it is when it gets busy but the attitudes, looks  and hostility made me not want to step foot in this place ever again.   

I love the view outside.  That counts as one star... I should at least give two because I can bring my drink out on the balcony..... again, that's almost shouldn't be an issue either way.

The issue here is the bartenders, AVOID this place, if you don't have a buzz. If you do, by all means go in and order a drink and wait on the Balcony it should be ready about time your buzz goes away...
author: E. A.

description:
Catching up with my reviews, I'm looking through the photos of places that I've been to and "The LookOut"  like most of the bars in Castro, have provided me a memorable experiences.

Drinks here are fantastic and the bartenders are super friendly.  My BFF loves martini,  though it is not my drink of choice,  but who can say no to Vodka right?  

Take advantage of their fantastic outdoor patio overlooking Market Street.  There,  you can definitely do your "LQQKOUT" and give your eyes a bit of an exercise!  After all,  it's okay to look as long as you don't touch as we "coupled"  relationship fellas would say!  Take my word,  you wouldn't want to come home and get your balls chop-chop!  :p

Some of the advantages of coming here are:

-great view from the second floor 
-outdoor patio 
-omg,  yes omg; they serve food!  Sip and drink and munch while you froth yourself and drool with all of the hot muscles walking by from the local gym across the street 
-Sunday's here are so much fun with a dj and with great music
-everyone here are super friendly 
-it's a bar for everybody

So when you find yourself in this neighborhood,  LQQK no further but where else...  at The LookOut! 

Until then,  Cheers!   ~ :p
author: Edwin R.

description: My boyfriend was harassed at this establishment and when I reported it the security guard they talked to the accused and then did nothing to remove him from the premises. He was extremely drunk and later on that night another drunk customer who could barely walk threw up all over the floor and on our shoes. The drinks being offered were so strong and by the end of the night even i had a difficult time keeping up. They don't seem to care about much except packing this tiny place and putting their patrons as risk. If you value feeling safe and want to enjoy your evening you will avoid this bar.
author: Mitchell G.

description:
This review is specifically related to the wonderful experience we recently had during a private event fundraiser on 10/1. The Private Events Manager, Nicole Van Ness and bartender, Rhonda made the entire experience extremely positive from beginning to end, including drinks, food and attentive service. 

We all had a great time and I would highly recommend Lookout for a private event with the help of Nicole.
author: Keith G.

description:
Appropriately named for sure...the place to see great views and to people watch.  My friend rented out the mezzanine area from 12:30 - 3:30 on a Sunday afternoon for his birthday.  It's got a few tables and a couch with a long table.  Good for parties of about probably 20ish.  It does have a green house effect though because of the glass windows.  The f&B minimum for the room is $300, not too bad.

2 unisex bathrooms - 1 with 2 stalls and 1 single use.  Booze was strong and standard price.  They were charging people $2 cover when I was leaving, pretty sure this is the norm for Castro (from what I remember from The Cafe).  Definitely the place to be on the weekends and scope everything and everyone out.  3.5 rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description: I gotta feel sorry for the bar tenders early evening 1/4/2018 who although they made an ok bloody mary turned up the VOLUME on Will & Grace ALL the way destroying whatever cozy ambiance there was in the place.  As a former service industry person working with bar tenders I rarely criticize; but, this was over the top.  It was raining out too so I suppose the bar tenders were competing as real drips ... .
author: David S.

description: The bartenders plus all the staff I encountered were seriously awesome!!! They were all so nice, and very accommodating! I have nothing but good things to say about this place. I went here two nights in a row and they remembered what I drank! That seriously doesn't happen very often. So, I was flattered when it did. The bathrooms seemed pretty well kept aside from running out of ass hats (toilet seat covers) from time to time. Also, this place has kick ass music! Shout out to the DJ's big time! It's hard to find good mixes nowadays!
author: Megan M.

description: I love the drinks!!! The ambience is the best. I love coming on Sunday's for the food and the drinks. I really enjoy myself here with my girlfriend. No drama very loving people. The bartenders are the greatest!! If you want to come for a good time in the Castro. This is the spot to go!!!!
author: Daisy M.

description:
I came here for Happy Hour, and they have pretty good deals. $4 well drinks, margaritas, and bud lights. (Their cocktails are not weak.) $8 sangrias, which many friends told me is apparently not worth it. My favorite is the $3 beer bucket deal because they put several special beers into one bucket leftover from an event, so there are basically "limited edition" beers that are not regularly stocked at The LookOut. It's also convenient that they have their food list and prices displayed above the bar, which probably makes the bartender's job way simpler.

It didn't take long to figure out why this place is called "The LookOut." The outdoor patio area along the second floor is way cool! Great place to people-watch, if you're into that. Overall, this place has a good mix of people, and it's not too crazy or not too chill. Would come back here again for some dancing and drinks!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Rude to my handicapped friend. I cannot leave much of a review. We did not go in because of their response to accessibility.
author: Matthew Z.

description: Drinks are gross. Bartenders are the absolute worst and discriminate. Vibe is weird. I'll never go back. You could literally have a better time with food poisoning.
author: Vic Y.

description: I wrote a review on this place before as very clean and it's great to have a patio but caution!!  Every time I open a tab, close it then check the next day i always find extra tip added that doesn't match what I put on the merchant receipt.
author: Brad B.

description: Not handicap accessible and the bouncer today was rude about it. Left and went to a different bar.
author: Kaitlin L.

description:
being san diegans we had a hankering for margaritas.
they weren't good here at all.  we learned our lesson.
but this is a nice place with a view and you can tell the locals love it.  nice music and playing mean girls on tv.  i liked it!
author: Brian K.

description: The LookOut is nice place to drink because it has a outdoor patio overlooking the intersection of Market St, Noe St, and 16th St.  I typically like the music they play here and enjoy the DJ's.  The only downside to the place is that with all the windows and wood floor, there is nowhere for the various sounds to be absorbed, so it's loud.  The bar also shares the space with a restaurant that serves pizza.  I've never ate there, so I can't speak to the food quality or menu.  The place is poorly setup, so the restaurant side of things is completely out of sight and out of mind.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Well hello there Hella Happy Hour. I recently discovered the Lookout on a recent trip out to the Castro for cocktails. I'm somewhat of a light weight now, so I needed a little something something.

Here's a little tip: If you are going out in the Castro, you need no pre-gaming, just some food before you hit all them two-for-one specials and dance clubs. Woo-Hoo, believe me...I learned my lesson. 

I ordered the 21st Amendment's Watermelon Beer. It's light, yet somewhat filling and fruity. Perfect for drinking with a meal or BBQ type foods.

We ordered the Hawaiian Chicken Sliders and the Mini Corn Dogs. Both were really amazingly good and what a deal, everything is cheaper during Happy Hour!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
I have been curious about this place for the longest time so when a friend and I were out walking around, we decided to go inside. 

Other nights, I've seen the Lookout balcony REALLY packed. It wasn't so crackin' the night we went (Thursday). A decent crowd. More like a bunch of intimate groups.

My friend and I ordered Amaretto Sours ($6 each) and I tried to order tacos. They have a kitchen menu but the kitchen closes at a certain time. 

Amaretto Sours were good, just a little syrupy. 

Lookout balcony would have been more interesting if there were actual things happening outside. Some nights are probably more interesting than others for people watching so I'm assuming that's part of why the place itself wasn't really filled that night.

Pretty cool place. I wouldn't mind going back. It kinda broke my heart to see so many handsome gay men I couldn't have for myself though.
author: Sofia R.

description:
I'll echo what other folks have said here. The balcony is great on sunny days and for drinking cocktails and people-watching. 

The service however, is REALLY bad. The bartenders have the worst attitudes and act like its a big inconvenience to serve you. Especially Jimi. I am a good tipper and used to work as a waiter, so am always polite to staff. In return you get bad attitude and crappy service. Not worth it for the price of drinks. Two stars
author: Jay K.

description:
Last stop before my flight back to Las Vegas :(  I really wanted to check out the Castro district in San Fran.  My friend took me to this place as they had a nice outside balcony area.

The thing that makes this place stand out to me is the location.  Definitely the location.  It's in the middle of the intersections of Noe, 16th and Market.  Yes, definitely a busy intersection.  The cool thing is you see all the action. 

The place is alright.  Little small and the outside balcony fits a few people.  The bartenders were nice, but definitely could see a not-so-pleasant side.  There were a few instances where they snapped at guests which surprised me.  

My visit was in the day time, however, I would like to return to this place to check out the nightlife and get a better sense of the place.  Hopefully my rating will change for the better.
author: Rockne H.

description:
The Lookout is always a fun place to come to with friends.
The drinks are good, bartenders nice, and the people make the atmosphere enjoyable. 
When I drink I like to think I'm a very happy and nice person and will assume everyone around me is too. Well, I usually get that here. People are really nice.
And that balcony... I it's so fun to people watch. To just sip down a nice beverage with your friends and take in San Francisco and it's wonderful people.
author: Eff B.

description:
My first gay bar!  WOOOOOOO!!

It was St. Patty's Day (I know I'm lagging a bit on this review HA!), and I was more than stoked to get crazy in the Castro with my girls.  

SCENE:  Great eye-candy 
ATMOSPHERE: Think disco ball, colorful lights, and lots of dancing.  
MUSIC: Not your slow bump and grind scene.  It's more Kesha, Britney Spears, Katy Perry.  
SERVICE: Our bartender for the night was the sweetest thing ever.  Free lollipops for everyone!  Oh and did I mention the drinks were dangerously delicious?
Another highlight of gay bars - the little girls' room is NEVER crowded!      

There was definitely no shortage of delicious men, free shots, and lots of dancing.  It's everything I imagined a gay bar to be and so much more! :D
author: Cecilia S.

description:
I'm writing about some awful customer service I experienced at The Lookout this past Monday evening around 10:15 p.m., on September 26th.

I had to use the restroom, rather urgently! Upon my arrival I noticed the bathroom was not only filthy, but each stall was out of toilet paper. I attempted to use the single bathroom, but it was occupied. So I approached the bartender who was just standing there, he was not busy, and let him know there was no toilet paper. He looked as if I was insane, and then casually said "oh yeah, we're all out" as if that was an acceptable response. I paused for a moment, surprised by his reaction, and said "ok, so what are you telling your customers then?" To which he then said, "well I don't know, no one has ever asked for toilet paper before!" Im not kidding, he actually said that. That cavalier response combined with his complete lack of customer service skills were annoying enough, but even more so because I reeeally  had to use the bathroom! I asked him if he was the Manager and when he said no, I asked him to go get them. According to him the Manager was unavailable. Finally, after arguing with him for a few minutes he reluctantly agreed to go find some toilet paper. This entire time I did not see anyone else buying drinks or needing help. And there was a second bartender on duty anyway. 
He then leaves the bar and is gone for a few minutes, and returns with no toilet paper. Next, he disappears for a few more minutes and eventually returns with a single roll of toilet paper and just sets it on top of the empty dispenser in one stall. Meanwhile the second stall still has none. He says nothing to me and proceeds to just go back to the bar. As he passes, I said "thank you." Even though I would have rather just said a few expletives. 

Even if I felt better and relieved, quite literally, that whole encounter left me with a bad impression and I chose to just leave. Why on earth should I spend my money at a place where the bartender thinks that its ok to treat his customers that way. While I'm  sure people that work in a bar have to deal with crazy or drunk people often, that does not entitle them to provide horrible customer service like that. The bartender was rude, condescending, and flat out lied just because he didn't want to do his job which includes more than just standing there and expecting a tip for just pouring a drink or opening a bottle. 

I certainly don't plan to go back there anytime soon!
author: L. A.

description: There's cheap drinks and a nice place to look out and people watch. I like the open windows and balcony here. The drinks are good priced and very strong in alcohol content. For credit cards, there's a two drink minimum though.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Beautiful! FYI: The hours I had my fun was during happy hour on the weekday in the early afternoon! Not too busy, lots of seating, yummy snacks, and perfect drinks (strong ones) to make the hours definitely happy! I liked how there were a few nice lounge areas near the glass windows to LOOKOUT and view the part of the Castro. 

Very modern. Even the bathrooms were something to LOOKOUT for. Who has blue light hand dryers in their bathroom?! Well, the LOOKOUT does! 

Jalapeno Poppers were nice and spicy, well mildly spicy.
50/50, the french fries and sweet potato fries were large enough for 2 people.
And again, the drinks offered during happy hour were strong! Even though I was craving a drink that wasn't on the menu, the best bartender ever made a creative drink and oh yeah, def hit the spot!
author: Christine F.

description:
One of my favorite spot in the Castro!
The view is amazing! Come early, the place gets packed fast. Drinks are nice and strong and the selection of beer is decent. This bar is worth checking out if you're ever in the Castro.
author: Mya M.

description:
me and my partner came here on saturday night and had a great time. The balcony alone is worth coming for and great for people watching, i dont think you can do that anywhere else in sf like you can here. The crowd is always friendly HAAAYYYYYY! 

:)
author: Ryan S.

description:
I like Friday happy hours at the Lookout. They've got $3 Skyy cocktails starting at 3:30pm which nobody in the Castro could beat that. Sometimes I'm in the mood of premium vodka drink and I'll have a Goose cosmo and it's just $8.50 during happy hour. It's the great place to jump-start the weekend. Depending on the weather, I like to sit on the balcony that affords the neighborhood's premium spot of people-watching.

I like the connecting room to the left side when I want to hang out and chill with friends. You just walk over to the bar and buy your drinks. In the lounge area they have high tables and a couch. As for food, my staples are the carne asada and pollo verde tacos are tasty. You get two for $5.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Such a great experience! I've been coming here for a decade now and love the staff, with their love and kindness. It's definitely an open arms community, and a wonderful rallying point. With a food menu, ninja-skilled bartenders, and variety of events it fits just about every peg you could offer. If you want huge crowds and thumping dance beats, they've got them; if you want to catch up with a friend over drinks on the balcony, they've got it; if you want a throng of every sexy gay man at your service, they've got them. Tip to the wise though, pick your nights. Sundays are packed, Friday and Saturdays are high energy, and every other day is sublime. These guys deserve best gay bar 3 years running!

Not to mention the reserve room!
author: Brad F.

description: This is a gay bar not a frat house so straight people check your privilege at the door. No one wants to see drunk straight preppy guys taking their shirts off and making a fool out of themselves. And straight girls you need to stop with the "woo woo" what is that? I give this place 4 stars because it's great once the obnoxious dude bros and marina girls finally leave. Maybe putting hardcore porn back on the tvs will help.
author: Derek I.

description: It's a fun place for all ages. And when I say all ages, normally best for 21-50 years old. The drinks are reasonable, and the staff is nice and rude. But of course not all at the same time. There's an outside patio, and you can smell the death outside because people use it to smoke. And I don't mean dick.
author: Vinson H.

description: fun place but roofie central...watch your drinks.
author: Ernest S.

description: Weak drinks, lack luster interior, rude staff. So many more venues surpass this place. Management and people looking for a place to go: send me a message and I'll give you some better recs in the hood.
author: Matt S.

description: Bro-y gay scene with free wings on Friday nights (they're alright). I think they have a real menu somewhere but it's so packed I just ordered something random that was too sweet. It is SO HOT in there. Then everyone's smoking on the balcony. Sigh.
author: Vivian H.

description: Nicest bartenders you will meet! We attended a birthday at the Lookout and had a blast! Drinks were flowing, Deejayed music, funny videos playing and oh the people watching!
author: Psusennes R.

description:
This is one of my hood places I usually go for drinks.  Bartenders are very friendly.  Drinks are great (you can use CC there).   There are lot of views and you can sit outside and enjoy the beautiful scenery.

I had one billing situation and emailed my concern to Gregg (GM) and Chris (owner). The billing situation was resolved quickly in a day, and I am happy with that.  Very professional and sincere guys.
author: vadim m.

description:
I like the energy in this place.  There weren't douches on site (Thank God they stay in The Marina a lot). They had a male gogo dancer that was shaking his bits to the groovy tunes blasting inside the bar. I was surprised that he was a regular looking guy.  I was expecting someone ripped or "muscley".  The guy knew how to dance and make it clap though. I liked the music that was playing and it really made us want to dance. Too bad me and my girlfriends were the only ones dancing so that was quite awkward. 

I like being able to "look out" onto Market Street. There's a lounge area in the back with a full view of the bustling street and it looked like it would be a perfect spot to hold a party. The fireplace and squishy seats made it look inviting. Outside, there's a balcony where the fire breathing dragons congregate so that they can keep their cancer fumes to themselves.  Even though the balcony was in open air, the smoke somehow lingered in the vicinity and made me start wheezing. I used to be a fire breathing dragon a couple years ago so I was really surprised that their fumes affected me.

Because I was sober driver for the night, I wasn't able to try their $5 drink special that my buddy Kassidy loved. It was a rum punch type of drink which she happily guzzled within minutes. It smelled good and I saw that they put a good serving of alcohol in it. I hope they have this special next time I visit. I noticed that they had a food menu but we weren't able to try it because my friends wanted to try another bar. I want to go back here and try the snacks.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description: The LookOut is a cool bar! there is a fee to get in but either than that a dance floor, sexy gay men, and awesome drinks make it up.
author: Galya T.

description:
Jimmy Jimmy Jimmy! 

Cool vibe, friendly bar tenders great food. 

Sliders: were oh so delicious, they literally melt away in my mouth, I cant believe it took me this long to try the food. 

has a very nice balcony so you can have a nice view of the Castro night.
author: Juana S.

description:
perfect place to go after Sunday bottomless mimosa brunch if you want to experience the Sunday shitshow!

people watching is one of my favorite things to do, and the crowd inside as well as the balcony that overlooks Market Street provide ample opportunities to do so.

this place is FUN! just beware the stairs on your way out... handrails are your best friend!
author: Sam D.

description:
this establishment reminds me of the wrong cruise i took once

kiddin, they sponsored our softball team and was the 2nd gay bar i stepped into in sf.  first being the old kimo's on polk pre g word, pre tech boom 2.0 which i popped in unknowingly.  lets face it the gays know fun and they know how to party

big fan as the people, food and balcony view here is all worth it.  strong drinks and fair prices as they make a pretty mean thin pie too.  if your up for a happy vibe w/good folks, good laughs, dancing or people watchin on a sunday afternoon or evening for that matter...you've found it

phobes and fun police not welcome
author: Clark G.

description:
Came here after the 49ers NFC championship win, and the place was packed! The outdoor deck was pretty nice. And for as packed as it was in the bar altogether, there was still an OK amount of room to walk around here. For as busy as it was, the bathroom was never so busy that I had to wait in line. There was a good amount of urinals (might I add, clean ones) that were available to use. And there was actually soap and a working hand-dryer.

The drinks were OK. Albeit, they were cheap, but they were mixed only OK.

There was a DJ, but it's not exactly a dancing type of bar. Unless, you're that one random go-go dancer in the corner.

I would probably come back for another chill afternoon-drinking. It's not exactly a final-destination type of bar, I don't think.
author: Shawn B.

description:
The beer bust parties are the best at this venue and although the view should give this place a few more stars, The LookOut always seems to fall a bit short.  Once you find the door (located next to the nutrition shop on the corner in between Squat and Gobble) and walk up the stairs you'll be greeted by an ever-so-not-very-friendly doorman or tranny sitting down looking as if they live the toughest life known to man.  Your job isn't that hard, so smile because at least you're getting paid.

First thing's first... a drink!  The bar is pretty accessible considering it's located in the middle of the room and takes up half the floor, so once your find your spot you'll be greeted by another not-so-friendly bartender serving your drink.  They do their job and that's about all you can ask.

Other than the service needing a boost in energy and enthusiasm this bar isn't so bad. Grab a seat outside if you can and enjoy the view of some of the Castro.  I give this place 2 stars because of the experiences I've had here with the staff.  Not the worst of times but The LookOut could work a little harder.
author: Kevin J.

description:
$4 cranberry vodkas
$3 basket of french fries

There's a great view to "Look Out" from and over Castro. The entrance is next to Squat and Gobble where you'll find a staircase leading upstairs. Friendly bar. I only wish the drinks were a bit colder! Had to led the vodka and juice mix around the few small cubes of ice for a little while.
author: Samantha L.

description: Cool place to sit upstairs and have drinks and overlook the Castro. The fm drinks are fairly cheap here too.
author: Aman S.

description:
3.5/5 margarita time!

$6 for a margarita bar. they serve you a full glass of just margarita and a little sweet and sour. then you take one of the pitchers full of juice/nectar and flavor to your own taste. after 1 you'll be good, after 2 you'll be better!

they have a few regular shows and events here, so it's always a spot to hang and have a good time.
author: Alvin D.

description: Great place for people watching on the balcony on a sunny afternoon. Drinks are well priced, staff are friendly, and the music is good.
author: Samantha B.

description:
I suspected the onset of a headache, and oh did it come..
I feel like a car crash progressing in slow motion, frame-by-frame whenever I end up here.
author: Ty T.

description:
Amazing and enormous margaritas! Depending on the night (or how cold it is) I love the balcony here that overlooks much of the Castro foot action (yes here, not so much on Castro/Market or 18th/Castro like you would think). What makes LookOut better for coming on the regular is that it always feels cleaner than the other Castro bars, they take plastic and the crowd is good. 

PS- Blue Star from the cocktail menu and $3 well drinks happy hour on Fridays FTW! http://lookoutsf.com/menu/main/
author: Chris W.

description: I just love this place with balcony to do people watching! Besides the have Chimay on the tap! How could I resist that! The best Belgian Ale for sure! Also had the tex-mex style queso, the cheese dip was absolutely yummy! Will upload more pics later!
author: Lang C.

description:
It's definitely not my favorite bar in The Castro and it's not the worst by far, so how does this place get a solid five stars above all of my other spots in The Castro? 

THEY SERVE FOOD!

I don't always want to leave my seat at the bar and have to go out of the bar, down the street and eat, only to return and find I have my seat taken and everything else is crowded.

The fact that this place serves food makes it my go-to spot when I'm hungry and thirsty and want to kill two birds with one stone. Also, you can always catch a sports game on one of their TVs. I've come here many times knowing that I'm guaranteed a seat, some great food and a good time.

Kudos, Lookout. I didn't like you much at first, but I've grown to love you.
author: Trav M.

description: This is a fun little venue not to be taken seriously. Their balcony area seems to cause more disturbance than it does good. People randomly keep going in and out and when they get where they need to be, they don't seem to know why they're there. The drinks are a good deal in comparison to other bars. The music is fun. The crowd is laid back and friendly. Pretty much anyone you talk to here randomly will have a conversation with you also.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
ok... Gay, Straight, Bi, or totally confused...  Whatever!  This place is THE place to let it all hang out.  From the front door ID check to the rock hard fakies I squeezed on the Door Lady ~  Everyone feels welcomed and a part of the gang here at The Lookout! 

I can't remember the name of the absolutely incredible bartender ~ THAT is how GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOD his drinks were!  

There were games & prizes, there were drinks, there were shots, & I swear the sexiest man in the bar tastefully gave it a go at my boyfriend.  Totally flattering.  I had to say a few good words about the Lookout and post some fun photos we took while we were there since I thought some of the photos already posted were a bit silly and boring compared to our experience.  I will be back, everyone!  See y'all at The LOOKOUT!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Bronzed, they roam cradling cranberry 
vodkas against their puffed out chests 
and place perky lips on double straws
to suck up the liquor which travels
straight into their eyes which gleam
at the pair of slight shoulders 
which greet the bouncer with twin
dollar bills to join the Sunday frenzy.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Honestly fuck this place. The girl bar tender last night was amazing and so kind. She made me a drink around 1:20 so it wasn't technically last call and I was just going to buy a shot. Well it was 1:49 and one of the workers snatched the drink out of my hand and tossed it when yea I get you close at 2 but what the fuck to snatch it out of my hand is just pathetic. That person I feel sorry for because they must have a shitty life to do that to someone. As a customer service representative I am disappointed. I spent 12 $ on a stupid drunk that I didn't drink. If ur gonna be a nasty person then don't fucken work at a bar. DUH?! Work somewhere u can handle since there's no patience what so ever in your life. So dumb. Any who don't come here if ur in San Fran so many better bars. No one was even here and it was Saturday night!!!! The bar down the street would have been a better choice. Fuck this place
author: Linda F.

description: If this bar assumes you are drunk they are very rude. I have never been drunk at this bar. Lost my sunglasses there and was reprimanded for asking.
author: Maiku B.

description:
so, i don't really know what the hell is going on right now.    these nerds are throwing bean bags and everyone is leaving on a tuesday night.   maybe this is a one time thing, but do not come on tuesday horseshoe night.    i used to really love this place too.   bummer.  

update.   i went back on a sunday afternoon and had a lot of fun.  maybe it was just a random weird tuesday gen-y thing
author: Eric - Bo -Dereck A.

description: as a visitor to san fran the staff are really welcoming and the drinks are just right.. like your local bar .
author: Chris M.

description:
Brain Farts with Pollo del Mar last Monday was fun. It wasn't very crowded which was a plus and minus. Plus because we got our food and drinks quickly and minus because it wasn't AS rowdy as I hear it usually is. However, the theme was "rain" and the questions were good. 

I'm not a trivia whiz or a competitive person but I do enjoy an occaisional quiz night with friends. Pollo of course is highly entertaining with her quips and comments that are both loving and deprecating. Group names were naughty and full of inuendo and I love that winners get free shots.

The food was really good too. I had the Mission Steak Wrap. Came with crispy shoestring fries and my friend had the sliders with sweet potato fries. Very yummy.

Go to Brain Farts on Monday for some good, well priced eats. Work your brain and be prepared to laugh and get your drink on.
author: Lianni C.

description: Absolutely love Monday night karaoke here! Super cool crowd, great drinks, and very cozy, comfortable seating and great views of the city all around.
author: Terry A.

description: The lookout is a great bar, with some lovely bartenders and great deals on thirsty Thursday as we call it! Great establishment and I love that you can sit outside and see most of San Fran
author: Laura B.

description:
Good food and drinks. They accidentally overcharged me $2, and when I called about it the owner of the restaurant personally called me, apologized, and refunded my entire purchase on venmo 5 seconds after getting off the phone. It was very sweet of him! That and the balcony is dope too!

Finally, on Sundays they let various gay sports teams and other organizations do fundraisers at their establishment, for which I give them mad props! Good food + friendly people + positively affecting the community = 5 stars!
author: Marko J.

description:
Every time I happened to be by the LookOut there was a party raging. Day or night, it seemed the music and good times were neverending.

Well, I was kind of wrong in my assumption in that I got there a little after 2:00 p.m. on a Sunday and it wasn't poppin' at all. The oven wasn't even fired up yet! So my friend and I sat on the balcony, sipped back some beers, and waited for the kitchen to open up at 3:00. 

We ordered a feast, by the way. Sweet potato tater tots with chipotle aioli, jalapeno poppers (I swear we did, even though I don't see them on the menu), and a sausage pizza. 

Our food was placed in front of us just as the music started. It was though they wanted to give a soundtrack for the party that was about to happen in our mouths. The place started to fill up once the music started, but my friend and I stayed at our prime real estate on the balcony overlooking the Castro. I want to go back later at night to check out the night scene, even if it means foregoing the snacks. I'll save my day-drinking and dancing for Lime.
author: Jennifer B.

description: A pretty fun place - not as crazy on a Thursday night as I thought. And, a nicely diverse crowd. Overlook in particular is fun.
author: Andrew K.

description:
"LookOut" makes me think "makeout", which I love to do. But do you know what else I love? NACHOS! I enjoy the crunchy, cheesy delight so much that I eagerly answered "Nacho!" when a Starbucks barista in Santiago de Chile asked me for my name. Unfortunately, she decided to feminize mi nombre and wrote "Nacha" on the cup instead. Bitch.

Can you tell I love nachos?! 

I was especially horny for them after a few drinks last week and the chicken nachos here really scratched my itch. I don't remember much about the divine dish except the cheese was melted shredded cheese as opposed to the liquid-y Velveeta kind (which I love too). This is seriously a great snack for drunken fools but watch out when I'm around because I will eat the whole plate! Rawr!
author: Suany W.

description: Loved their music, drinks, and the view. I have not danced that crazy in ages. Everyone around me was great, so apparently great people come here. I had so much fun and I think this is going to be my new place to dance and party at. AMAZE-Balls!!
author: Sunny E.

description: Omg. Fun all the time.  As a straight gal it's sometimes hard to get a drink but just switch bartenders and it will be ok. I like it how there is food until past 9p. The balcony is a bonus - one can do fun people watching.  The bar has anything from crazy dance nights to chill karaoke evenings. Drinks are strong. ;)
author: Zita M.

description: I absolutely Love the LookOut! It is fun, the margaritas are killer, and by killer, I mean "locked in a bathroom because I cannot find the door out as a girl is chasing me around trying to take off my pants" killer.  Pretty much every time I go to the LookOut, it either ends my night by making me need to go home, or it ends my night by making sure I don't remember the rest of it.  Either way, it is one helluva good time.  I highly recommend "fishing" off the balcony, which basically entails dropping crumpled dollars and waiting until someone picks it up. You can yell things like "you are so close" or "ALMOST" but not tell them what it is about.  When someone finally gets the dollar, make a huge scene and make sure you see nipples.  It is a blast.
author: Dick S.

description:
They serve pizza here? 

Seriously?? And people go there for the pizza?

I've only been the bar, which judging by the go-go dancers they've had on duty there, is where they hang the extra sausage and pepperoni . . .

Lame culinary jokes aside, LookOut is an excellent place to meet for an early drink - the bartenders, in classic Castro style, do not mess around when they mix . No, there's nothing wrong with your drink. Yes, you idiot, you can't taste the tonic because it's all vodka.

The music's adequate, the crowd's festive, but the clincher is the balcony, which lets you chat while you watch the wildlife parade by below.
author: Karsten P.

description:
I've only been here once.  But i quickly found out that this is the spot to be at after Sunday Brunch.  

This is how Sundays go in the Castro:  Eat at Lime and then shoot over to The LookOut for the after party.  Then once nightfall hits  dispurse to the clubs of your choice later on that night.  So you start at 9am and end at 2am.  and the LookOut is definitely on the list of things to do on a sunday!    

I'm a pro fag hag and i LOVE to be around my gay men ;)  I love that the bartenders are feisty.  I love that there's a patio that wraps around this place.  I love that the drinks are reasonably priced.  I JUST LOVE THIS PLACE.  

LOVES IT!
author: Marie T.

description: Rude!!!  Came to Castro with friends to spend the day trying out the different bars in the area. We were having a blast until we walked in the Lookout. It was early on Saturday evening - not busy. Door man was extremely rude to us for no reason...and so we moved to the bar to order drinks and the female bartender was just plain disrespectful and seemed as if she didn't like her job or the people "customers" she was serving.   Had one drink and left.  Very disappointed the only bad experience of the day the rest of the bars and restaurants in the area were super fun and welcoming!
author: Zoey H.

description: Cool space on second floor with glass on all sides overlooking Market & Castro, and long deck with stools. $3 cover on Saturday is a little silly. 90% gay males. A little dead for a Saturday. Limited beer selection and slightly overpriced.
author: Brian L.

description: Good place for post sunday brunch, and to perch on the balcony and do some people watching.  Very lax atmosphere for a sunday afternoon.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Lookout is I would say 1 of the standouts of the Castro bars. 

- It's a good place to grab a drink, maybe food if they're still serving it, or just hang out with friends or a date in their outside patio "looking out" over Market Street. It's somewhat shielded from the music blaring inside so a conversation is POSSIBLE to have, that aspect alone makes Lookout one of my favorite bars in SF/Castro. 

- the crowd Is hit or miss though. Most likely due to some days having a cover that's substantially higher that what they charge at the more popular Badlands. 

- Drinks are moderately priced and are made well. No complaints there.

 Overall cool place to "See & Be Seen" up top. Not a place you will stay in all night but definitely worthy of  a spot in anyone's Castrol Bar Crawl.
author: Lorénz B.

description: been wanting to go there for a long time. sadly at 11pm on a Friday night (my birthday), it wasn't super crowded but the music was good, the patrons were friendly and the bartender gave me a free beer for my bday. i'd like to go back when it's more crowded to get the full experience but i did have fun looking out over Market Street and hanging with my girlfriends.
author: Tera K.

description:
It's a man's world in here. (I kinda wished I was a good-looking guy when I came here my first time).

Still, I had a ton of fun with my co-workers, kicking back strong (cheap!) drinks and munching on tasty happy hour snacks like sweet potato fries. 

The person I appreciated most here was the DJ. He was so determined to play that song, keep me dancing (dancing) all night (all night)... No joke, we requested a song by the Killers and when he didn't play it for awhile, we asked him again and he assured us he hadn't forgotten, he was just waiting for the right transition. Smoother than Dr. J. 

The bartenders could crack a smile every once in awhile (I mean, it wasn't like there was a maddening crowd or something) but maybe it was too early in the week for nonsense. Anyway, had a good time and it made me look forward to more hangouts at the Lookout.
author: liz c.

description: This is a happening place most of the time I understand. We went Sunday afternoon and it was really hopping and a fun place to be. The drinks were well made and I love that they offer SKYY vodka. I tried to buy one of their cool t-shirts but they were out of medium ones. The boy dancer was very hot as well. Jimmy the bartender was the best.
author: Steven J.

description:
I can't believe I've never written a review for this place. I probably come here once, maybe twice a month and I've always had a good time. I've never had the food or been there on a Sunday (when there's apparently always a fundraiser of some sort going on) but on both Fridays and Saturdays this place is pretty fun. 

Fridays can be hit or miss as far as the crowd goes (I don't think they have any sort of theme/promotion on this night), but it's never too crowded and for the most part it's friendly. Saturday night is when they have "Social." This entails a $4 cover, better music than on Friday, and for the most part a "prettier" crowd. 

The thing I really like about this place is that it's one of those bars where it can be whatever you want it to be. There's a couple areas where they have tables and chairs inside so I if you wanna sit there all night, in a t-shirt and jeans, and be casual it's fine. If you wanna dress up a little more and stay near the dance floor that's fine too! There balcony is always fun for people watching down below and I've had some interesting conversations with random guys out there. 

They have a full bar, standard drink prices, and pretty hot bartenders. Good times all the way around :)
author: George A.

description: Great location, nice view overlooking the crazy intersection of Castro/Noe.The owner is extremely nice and responsive and contacted me after my initial review to inquire why I had misgivings. I thought about it and it isn't the place itself -- it's that the patrons tend to be a bit more "clubby" than I am.
author: Allison L.

description: Quickly becoming one of my favorite bars in the Castro.  Awesome balcony, good drinks, and fun crowd.  I came here on Saturday night of pride weekend and had a BLAST; good amount of people, but much calmer than the mayhem of pink party.
author: Michael D.

description:
The restaurant section is totally B.Y.O.B. (Bring Your Own Bear) or at least binge-and-purge-worthy because the portions are huge and the carbs are free flowing!  It's far from fine dining, but decent for this culinary-starved neighborhood.  The appetizers tend to have the most unique arrangements but the deep dish pizza is decent.

Italian Nachos: I never never never thought I'd find such a unique and tasty snack at a Castro bar!  Pasta chips kind of taste like pizza dough made into chips.  The asiago cheese and Italian sausage are what really makes the dish because they beat queso blanco and chorizo any day!  The tomatoes, peppers and olives add a nice contrast but were merely wingmen to the aforementioned stars of the party.

Cheese Fries: Pretty boring.  After having such a great asiago cheese on the Italian nachos, I expected more.  Both cheeses were bland and melted on... cheez whiz would have even been better.  Definitely avoid as there are much better ways to have your carbs.

Chicken Club Deep Dish Pizza: Why put the chicken as the headliner when there is yummy bacon and ham?  My pizza expertise is more in the NY-style realm, so I can't comment too much on the attempted Chicago-style authenticity.  It was tasty, but super filling.  I didn't like that the parmesan cheese offered was powder rather than something freshly grated.
author: Adam B.

description: Finally made it to the Lookout for Halloween! It was overly crowded but tons of fun! Great view. Had the "fish bowl" drink, creative touch =)
author: Tiff W.

description: I love this place! I love the vew, the drinks and the attention. It is also great for private parties. The food is delicious too.
author: Tatiana Z.

description:
Me: "It's loud in here!"
Wife: "What?"
Me: "Yes! Let's go out onto the patio!"

Me: "Ah, that's better. It's kinda cold up here."
Wife: "Yeah, but the beer is good."
Me: "Yeah. Hey, did 50 more people just crowd onto the balcony?"
Wife: "Looks like it. Nice view, eh?"
Me: "It sure is. Honey...I'm old. And straight."
Wife: "Pilsner Inn?"
Me: "Yes, please."
author: Chris H.

description:
The Lookout is a great place with a nice view of a busy city intersection. The crowd is good looking and friendly, the drinks reasonably priced, and they do a lot of fundraisers for good causes (my friend's softball team, tonight), which I like a lot.

It's a great place to pop in for an hour or with an out-of-town guest. I like it.
author: Sean B.

description: The wonderful service alone is reason to visit.  Michael and team are about the best bartenders in SF!  The drinks, decor and the view from the balcony are pretty awesome, too.  Great location for happy hour!  I'm happy to report this bar doesn't attract twinks or bachelorette parties.
author: Brian P.

description: I've recently went to this place because my friend was surprised that I never been to a gay bar and he told me I need to see how amazing and fun it is because I'm missing out and honestly I do admit he is quite correct! This bar I believe I can't quite remember has happy hour till 8pm because I was there around 6pm on a Friday and got $5 Margaritas which is a must get because it was in such a big glass and was quite delicious, if my friend didn't take too many shots I would've ordered another round. I love the atmosphere everyone was so jolly, the staff members were so friendly, and the music really makes you want to dance and smile. Even though this spot gets packed real fast there is enough room to walk around expect the patio when that gets crowded its quite difficult to get yourself out and back to the bar. The bathroom has two unisex and one gentlemen single so ladies don't get freaked out when you find men in the restroom, its perfectly fine.
author: Victoria G.

description:
On Sunday October 24th I met a friend at Lookout at 5:30.  I have to tell you -- I was one happy patron. 

I'm very much a SOMA DADDY type, and with my bar I work a lot and don't get up to the Castro more than maybe once or twice a month to hang out for drinks.  Usually I go to 440, which I really like.  

I've been to LookOut a few times -- but yesterday was amazing.  The bartenders are top notch -- they totally pay attention to all the patrons.  I know when I bartend I totally like to let patrons knows I'm more than happy to serve them another drink when they are ready....but when I go out -- I usually have to beg for a drink - or the attention of a bartender.  Not the Sunday Lookout guys -- they all knew what I was drinking, they all checked in -- all a lot of fun, polite -- good team.

While I still plan to get to 440 a few times a month -- now I will have to include LookOut on my Castro stop -- with amazing service from these guys -- it's my new joint to hang.

Kudos!
author: David M.

description:
This is one of those places where if you don't come armed with a pose, you're probably not going to have a good time. That or I'm a horrible loser, but I'm just going to go with the first choice. 

My co-worker and I came here and were slightly annoyed by the stupid $5 cover. I thought this was a bar? Since when do you have to PAY to get into a stupid bar? And I just wanted a water (I don't drink) and it took 10 minutes for the bartender to hear us because the music is so damn loud and everyone is screaming...because the music is SO DAMN LOUD. 

I don't go out to the Castro a lot, but from what I've noticed there's 3 main groups of people. The good-looking, the bad-looking, and the medium. All the good looking guys come in gangs, the bad-looking guys come by themselves, and the medium-looking people come with their friends. And the problem is is that the groups never really talk to one another, and honestly I dont know how anyone can just approach another person in here because it is super intimidating to go up to someone when they're with all of their friends and try to strike up a conversation...then again, if you're coming to a bar, the end goal probably isn't a good date. I really didn't like this place. It just reaffirmed all the bad Castro stereotypes and the things I really hate about the gay "community." But at least I can say I've been here!

Damn, it's the most expensive water I've ever had
author: Dustin H.

description:
Had an awesome time here with a bunch of friends after breakfast at a nearby spot. We came here around noon for drinks and it was pretty quiet, so we headed to the outdoor lookout area for drinks and some smokes.

As we cheered attractive people and their puppies on from above the place slowly began to fill up and by 3pm it was packed with people. A drink sponsor for some juice infused vodka gave out shots from toned men in speedos as well as we bought a round of jello shots for our group and were given a complimentary DVD (adult film).

The bar area has a lot of room and with four bar tenders working it was easy for our group to continue to get drinks throughout the day. The drink prices were very reasonable as well. The entire place was very nice and clean. I want to go back to try the food next time.
author: Michael H.

description: Went here on a Friday night and the bar was almost completely empty. The crowd was rather mixed and the prices for drinks were ok, but all in all I was not too impressed. The nice thing about this place is that you indeed have, as the name suggests, a "lookout" area, meaning an outside area with a nice view over the Castro area.
author: Laura D.

description: Hello Saturday Margarita Bar @3PM - the bartender salts your rim (that sounds sinful) and fills up your pint glass about 3/4's full with tequila, and then you mix in your juice of choice. The options when I was there: peach, lime, or mango. Great people watching on Castro from the LookOut. Also, get the 50/50 fries. Trust me on that one!
author: Mal C.

description: The bartenders are the reason why I don't come here.  There are plenty of options in the Castro.
author: Derek W.

description:
I'm a total fan! I came here on Friday night for my Bestie's dual Bday party, very unfamiliar of the area. The booked a room upstairs with their own bartender (I can't remember his name but he was AMAZING!) and he made a wonderful drink the Fuzzy Navel but with champagne - I loved, loved, loved it. 
There was a main bar outside of our party which you could go to as well and I believe a dance floor - I didn't check that area out since I was busy gabbing away to our hostess's friends (I talk way too much... like the Energizer Bunny, I keep talking, and talking, and talking, and talking!). 
Everyone seemed to have a great time and the venue was very accommodating to our party. I wouldn't mind coming back to the Castro and scoping this place out some more!
author: Kelly T.

description:
There really is no better "win" feeling than waking up without a hangover when you're expecting the fattest one.  It's like seeing someone at the grocery store that you really don't want to see, and you just know they're going to come over and give you a hug, flash a fake smile, and pretend to be chatty and concerned with how your life is going... and then they just give a brief smile, small wave, and keep walking.  SIGH OF RELIEF.

After the Bubbles & Brunch YEE, J and I decided to hang out some more.  For us, "going out" usually means him trying to make me drink a lot in the Castro, and then me deciding I need to go home before I get said hangover and him continuing to flirt and party the night away.  It's a lot of fun.  So, after a quick stop at Lime for a mojito, we headed to the LookOut with a few other friends.

A $4 cover, two whiskey sours, a cran-vodka and a Malibu-pineapple (totaling $23) later, we were looking out onto Market Street on the patio because one of our friends wanted to actually "look out" while at the LookOut.  The people were super chill and laid-back, and there were a few people dancing inside, although they were mostly just standing around chatting.

The one star off (and I know it's not really their fault, but it totally ruined part of my night) is for their bathrooms.  It was disgustingly smelly.  Like smellier than any bathroom I'd ever been in.  Although it wasn't dirty, it literally smelled like something died in there.  I had to expedite my urination process so as not to pass out in there.

Note to self: bring a small spray can of Febreeze wherever I go.
author: Tori S.

description: Talk about a great location and an attractive young crowd, friendly bartenders. Can get rowdy rather quickly. However I avoid any place that charges a cover charge on a Sunday.
author: Hotel B.

description:
An excellent first stop for a bar/club night out in the Castro. The Lookout bartenders make strong (and cheap!!) drinks - they mean serious business here. Service is a little slow at times. 

The balcony/patio makes it convenient to spot friends you're meeting up with. Good spot to get some fresh air, chat and watch the Castro festivities below. 

It's kind of awkward when people try to dance here. The music is certainly danceable, and the crowd is always lively, festive and friendly, but think of this as a pregame to places like Badlands or The Cafe. 

Oh yes, one thing you will never forget about The Lookout: the animated porn!
author: Waz W.

description:
Got there early-Pretty quiet after a nice dinner with a girlfriend. Drinks cycled, place got busier and BUSIER, of course, it was at Saturday night. Looking over the balcony, we almost saw two very potential fights(it was really good exciting people watching) - HENCE the name. 

 PLUS we made friends with an Olympic figure skater. I qualify that as an good night out.
author: Tara M.

description: The drinks here  are  a bit small compared to other places (they serve them in those flimsey plastic cups). But the crowd is nice and yuppish. It can get very crowded on Saturday night or Sunday happy hour. Despite the inability to maneuver in and around sometimes, I still find myself here with a plastic drink cup in hand.
author: Kenson K.

description:
I came here with my friend because her friends where having a party here.  The drinks were good.  1 star for having a pear cider - only thing my friend drinks - shes such a ligh weight. I probably wouldn't come here on my own if I'm looking for a good bar.  Tons of them around all over castro.  I'm happy this was my first time coming here - I know I'm not missing out on anything.

1 star for good drinks and 1 star for apple cider.
author: Darren N.

description: In general, they bus your drink you have within seconds so just be sure not to order a drink.
author: Rachel S.

description: Not a huge fan and once had my jacket missing for a few days after I left it on a couch.  It turns out they took it to lost and found and I got it back, but it was still annoying (I only left it for a few minutes).  In the end, not my scene (most of the time).
author: Ryan S.

description:
I'm basing my review on their trivia night.  I don't mess around when it comes to trivia.  JK, even though I am still working on my dream team, I knew based on the sample questions I heard from Joshua that this was going to be different.  

The ladies reading the questions and the crowd made it quite rowdy and fun but I don't enjoy long passages of time between questions so that was a little frustrating.  If you are looking for a fast paced game where questions are read and that's it, don't come here.  It's chaotic and lively so I would encourage heavy drinking which I am assuming was the point all along.

The portobello fries and sliders were pretty tasty and it didn't take forever to get a drink so I'd come back, just not for trivia.
author: Seong P.

description: Who in the world gave this place more than one star?  Stopped in.  Dead.  No one in the place.  Couldn't get service.  Bartender disappeared.   I left without giving them my money.  Oh, buy a broom and mop your floors.  Gross.
author: Ryan L.

description: No more free chicken wings for Friday night happy hour :(   BRING BACK THE FREE WINGS!
author: Dwayne G.

description: This is one of my favorite gay clubs in the Castro.  The people are welcoming and I like their different theme nights.  It's never been too crowded when I've been, so even though the dance floor is small, it's big enough to do your thing.  I like that they have a large wrap around patio to use when you need some fresh air.  I'd definitely return!
author: Jade F.

description:
Offering me my favorite drink of the night (an AMF), and meeting a random chick that was nonverbally willing to freak dance, made this place simply awesome!

It was also quite hilarious to see two drag nuns from the 2nd floor balcony!

Small $5 cover charge, but that didn't stop me from enjoying the night with friends.
author: Garett T.

description: There's a $3 cover charge to get in!  A bar?  Well at least the bartenders were cool, drinks were good & the music too.  The gay porn is interesting for me tho lol
author: Trynh K.

description:
I don't like paying covers, that being said the beer selection isn't bad.  Being a chick I was served almost immediately since, well, I am not the normal customer.  It is loud and there isn't much of a dance floor if that is your thing.  

They do have a large balcony for people watching in the Castro, but is that really the way you want to spend a night.  Wouldn't you want to meet someone you won't be shouting from a balcony too.  Then again maybe Romeo will be down there.
author: Megan P.

description: My least favorite spot at the Castro so far. It's quite big, has many areas. I didn't see a dance floor by the bar though.. did I miss it? I'm sure people really like this place, it's crowded when I've been. Just not my preference. Very mainstream. I imagine a group of girls going there for bachelorette party or something like that. Nothing wrong with that, just not my style. They do have a nice long balcony that "looks out" to the streets. Perfect if you like to smoke haha
author: Vol T.

description: I love how security keeps a low profile and you can relax here.
author: F T.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night, it was fun. Not a lot of people of course, but the bartender as really cool, and my friends had a great time. We ended up leaving after we had a couple drinks because we wanted to bar hop to somewhere else.
author: Lindsey V.

description:
I like it! Can't complain in the least! Pretty good drinks at good prices. I love being able to "look out" on the Castro/Upper Market while having a drink, if I like. 

Also, they have food from time to time - and it's pretty good food by different caterers/restaurants/chefs (not sure about how this part works, but what I had was tasty)!
author: Jason B.

description: The worst service I have ever had! I'm disappointed in the way the bartender ignored us the whole time I was there. We asked to close out after being there for a couple hours when it was slow and after being ignored almost the entire time we were there. I just looked at my account and he wrote in his own tip! I am in the industry and things have to be pretty bad for me to stiff someone! He and everyone there were obnoxious and completely unprofessional. We had a friend who recommended we go there while in town and I cannot believe how we were treated! I will NEVER be back and will be contacting the manager first thing tomorrow about the bar tender closing out his own tip! Unheard of! As far as I'm concerned that was the worst service I have EVER had!
author: Melissa O.

description: Happy Hour after work is nice.  Not too crowded, space out on the balcony.  Even though it wasn't  terribly crowded, it was still pretty loud, though!
author: Ken B.

description:
Their fries are super yummy! The pizza and service is also decent. Seating is limited but comfortable... I love to come here with friends after having mimosas at lime and snack on a pizza or two. 

Their calamari is also delicious... 

ONLY CONS: get it out of a club! I hate the fact that it is inside a night club like the lookout which is pretty much open for business 24/7. Also if I were a smarter owner I would extend T&T hours some could make some profit out of those drunken gays that hit lookout overnight... Just saying
author: NC B.

description:
I've eaten a lot of pizza in the last few days. And this was some of the best. The tomato pizza sauce had a nice kick, and the service was pretty quick and attentive. It's a bit unfortunate that it's linked to a bar because I'm sort of deaf in an ear so it makes it harder for me to hear...but other than that, I  thought the prices were pretty decent for what you get and the freshness of the place! 

mmmmpizza.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I love this place.  You can have it your way (just don't get crazy).  Seriously though, you can dance if you want to, you can chill, you can eat, you can go out on the lookout and watch the ongoings of Castro, etc.

The bartenders are hotties and even have a great attitude.  There's none of the BS that comes with some of the other gay bars.

Overall, it's a good place for good people.
author: Girls Named Cherise C.

description: Cool place, second floor with a nice little view of the area. Definitely seems to be one of the more active places in the area and the drinks were great at a good price!
author: Patrick L.

description:
$4 dollars for cover on a Saturday night, nice view on the balcony, amazing dancers all around, dance music blasting and GIANT DRINKS that are very reasonably priced.  

This pretty much sums it up.

And for the ladies, you won't feel poached on at all.  I may be stating the obvious but it's a gay bar, and I think it's perfect for a girls night out, where you just wanna have fun, have a few drinks, talk to cool, upbeat people and just enjoy yourself.
author: Zu W.

description:
Think out of all the bars we tried in the Castro....this was definitely one of our favorites...

From the name....you got a great view of the city....plus the drinks are totally affordable....comparing it to LA prices....the drink prices are a steal!

This place got busy a few times....but if you wanted a place where it wasn't so nuts you could have that too.....great music....great bartenders......awesome vibe....
author: Jay A.

description: Awesome place to hang out and meet guys. Friendly crowd, good drinks. I'm a fan!
author: Johnny W.

description:
On a gloomy day, one Sunday afternoon, after 2 pints of beer and 2 vodka drinks, Eric G., Mark M., David T. and I decided that it would be a great idea to go to the Lookout for a few more drinks.  Little did we know, this would become an epic day of booze, boobs, and boos!

It began with jell-o shots!  There's always room for jell-o and we found this to be our demise!  We just so happened to go on a day where there was a fundraiser for a local gay soccer team.  With one jell-o shot underway, we decided to start off with a drink each. Then we were on our 2nd drink.  This time i bought and let me just say that drinks were not unfairly priced but they weren't super cheap or anything either.  The bartenders we're particularly friendly but they got your drink to you with a quickness.  Not to say they were rude or anything, they just did their job and moved onto the next drink.  As I was buying all our 2nd drinks, David T goes and buys us each a shot of Patron.  So to recap, i've had 2 pints of beer and 2 vodka drinks from 2 previous places, a jell-o shot, a shot of patron, and 2 greyhounds.  

By this time, i've noticed that this place is pretty crowded.  People were pretty good looking, and everyone was minding their own business.  We then decide to go outside and hang out on the balcony or "lookout"  It's actually pretty nice.  you get a nice view of the area around you, which is just market and noe/16th.  We end up talking to 2 women and one of them ends up flashing us.  A few guys end up flirting with Eric G., Mark M. is drunk and having conversations with people, I don't remember what i'm doing and David T. leaves.

After this i don't remember the drinks we had.  I do remember more jell-o shots though!  Needless to say i did some things i never do in public, Eric G. had a great time, and Mark M. has an issue holding down his liquids.  By the time we stumble out of there, we are happy as hell and ready to go home.  

I really enjoyed the balcony outside... and the fact that there is a good solid crowd there all the time.  I see myself going back there for shits n giggles.  Anyone wanna join me?

PS jell-o shots are the debil (devil) !!
author: Aaron G.

description:
Great location, and the balcony is a plus..but..

The interior of this place needs to be gutted to the studs and redone. What a nightmare of flow and acoustics they have going in there! I don't know how many times I've found myself SHRIEKING my order to the bartender in order to be understood. They try to give you the total and if you don't read lips, all you can do is hand them a twenty and hope for the best.

If you stand by the doors it's freezing, if you stand in the back it's stifling, and that hulking bar in the middle of the room must have seemed cool in the '90s, but it just makes me tired, now.
author: Michael W.

description: First time in this bar, on a Sunday.  Waited 15 minutes at the service bar for a drink, and still was empty handed when we left.  Either they need more bar staff, better bar staff, the POS system is slowing down the bartenders, or all three.  The crowd was mostly young guys, and bars just aren't that fun if you CAN'T GET A DRINK!  The other reason for the 1 star is safety.  This place was WAY to crowded.  Think: Triangle Shirt Factory.  As we were leaving, someone was bring their bicycle up the stairs, can't believe the doorman would allow this.
author: EC N.

description:
It was a dreary December night. I had went to the Castro for some reason. I went into the bar, and this guy asked me if I wanted a drink with him. He assumed I was a fruitfly missing her fruit. We went up to the bar and had drinks.
