Eventually, a bunch of gay men of all ages joined in. It was a lively discussion for a Wednesday night. We talked about football, men, disco, Madonna, etc... It was amazing.

The rainbow beacon of SF still whispers my name and when it does, I'll be at the lookout and won't try to be that much of a bitch like I was at Badlands.

Love the disco balls.
author: Lana P.

description: The LookOut continues to be one of my most favorite places to celebrate love and community. I've hosted 2 parties there, and I am a regular patron. Chris Hastings and the entire staff (Gregg, Jarrad, Jimmy, etc...) are some of the warmest and most accommodating folks I've ever had the pleasure of working with. The drinks are delicious and reasonably priced, and the bar snacks are extra tasty. The venue is centrally located in the heart of SF's Castro district with a stellar view. The DJs are fantastic, and there's always fun entertainment - whether it's a dazzling drag show, live musicians, or simply the excitement of a bunch of feel-good people enjoying a lovely afternoon or night out. I can't say enough about how this place always gives me the best warm & fuzzies. Thanks, LookOut ~ See you on the dance floor...
author: Gypsy L.

description:
So I've been here for the Thursday "Beat the Clock" Happy Hour.
As you know, its 50 cent drinks from 4:00-4:30, $1 from 4:30-5, $1.50 from 5:00-5:30, etc.

I anticipated it being something ranging from an easy going happy hour where I can talk to my friends to some type of gang bang.  Luckily, it was the former.  Must've been the rain.

Anyway, The 50 cent wells are unbeatable.  These aren't just your regular shitty wells... but ginormous 6 count pours of seagrams that will get you bent by 4:20 for $1.50!  The bartender honestly poured half a fifth into four well drinks.

I'd stick with screwdrivers. The cranberry/vodka tastes like cough syrup... but if you add some promethazine it tastes a little better.
author: Joey S.

description: Fast and friendly bartenders, good music. Nice addition having lite food for purchase at the bar. I highly recommend the bar. Great scenery- in and outside the bar.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Hot Wings are GREAT!!!

Pizza, is just ok.

Drinks seem weak.
author: Jason B.

description:
I like this place a lot because the crowd is always fun and everyone always seems happy. However, I understand that people are raising money for their organization but EVERY Sunday is getting a little old. I like this place because it's fun but I can get my drinks somewhere else without a cover. And the LookOut isn't even the most exciting bar at the Castro.

With that said, I still think the crowd at the LookOut is very fun, real, and not superficial (aka not a WeHo/Badlands crowd). The people at the LookOut remind me that there are normal gay men at the Castro.
author: Rylan C.

description:
The food smelled great, the crowd was varied, the boys were cute, the balcony is nice, the trivia was easy enough to answer (but we still only managed to rise to mediocrity), Pollo del Mar was fun, Bebe Sweetbriar's mic sucked and we could hardly hear her, and the crowd was boisterous.
It was a fun, if at times infuriatingly loud night.
author: Jennifer D.

description: If you wanna forget everything about that day, come to this place! They gotz the best memory-loss jello shots you'll ever chug! LOVE THIS PLACE! ;)
author: Vanna M.

description:
Considering this was my first time at a gay bar...it was awesome!  We came early enough that there was no cover and $2 skyy vodka drinks.  There's a patio that was pretty much packed, so we ordered our (really strong) drinks and scoured the area for a place to get some apps since they were 1/2 off.  We found an empty lounge area with a cool view because I think most of the people there were to mingle, dance and get drunk!  The sweet potatoe fries were delish as well as their nachos.  

The staff was totally cute and when we asked if our gang could come back later in the evening, "only if you give me sexytime" was his response...cuuuute!

Once we left we just missed out on porn night because we could see the ripped stripper from across the street!  Definitely a place to have a good time with some of your friends.
author: Caren K.

description: Since the incident I e-mailed  the owner and he apologized and has changed his security staff :-).   They also have new bartenders who are great and even more the owner sponsored an event for me to help repeal  prop 8.  Thanks Lookout!!!
author: Christopher T.

description:
The LookOut makes me happy. I LOVE the bouncer on Thursdays, she's my favorite part of the LookOut experience. 

Location: Right between Church and Castro on Market and in front of Cafe Flore. Really easy to get to either by the dangerous MUNI or by vehicle.

Space: Not the best decor, which is why it gets a point marked off. With such a GREAT space, you'd think they would hire a good interior designer. Not bad though. My favorite part is that there's a balcony where you can drink, smoke and judge those less fortunate beneath you.

Ambiance: I usually go on Thursdays and I love my lesbians. The lesbians here are young, hip and hotter than any gay boy. Other than Thursdays, the crowd seems pretty bland, in a good way though, kind very quiet and chill.

Service: The bartenders are always nice and ready to give suggestions as to drinks. They make a good cosmo and martini. 

Food/Drink: I asked for something sweet and blue and she made an amazing drink. They make pretty good drinks and have a fair selection of alcohol.

Overall: One of the places I like to frequent on Thursdays. I love my lezzie nights there very much and hanging out there with friends on the weekdays is always a joy.
author: SF N.

description:
Hot lezzie bouncer.
She's fancier than the rest.
Don't go upstairs.
author: Chris Y.

description:
Surround deck is like surround sound, you get the FULL experience out here. The gossip, the kissing and oh my my the fondling. I love gay men and yes, I know that makes me a bona fide fa* ha*. Oh go freshen your makeup.

Came here on a pub crawl with nary a non-hetero swinger in our crowd and guess what? everyone still treated us with love. My dilemma? A place filled with sincere, gorgeous men looking for love and spice. LORD. I tried my bestest to hook up the cream of the crop with each other, but it seems that under 25 and full of um, "energy" was more the order of the day. 

Wig O'Rama was in full swing with a benefit for dental care for the toothy challenged south of the border. They were full of high spirits and so were the bartenders. Loved my stiff drinks and smiles. 

Like I always say, know what you want. This is a great bar to stop by and check out the 'view' from the deck and the scene, esp if you want to kiss your own kind, is friendly and boisterous. But if you are an electrical cord looking for his plug, keep it short and move on.
author: Miel H.

description:
Good drinks, good music, great balcony, cool drag queens.  

Drink prices vary per either bartender or the person ordering drinks...I haven't figured this out completely.  I learned for my gay friend, the drinks are cheaper than they are for me...the straight girl.  :)
author: Tiffany G.

description: This is a review for their Happy Hour. I went in when they had just opened so there was only a handful of people in but it was still a really nice venue. Kurt(kurk?) the bartender was sooo nice and talkative! His drinks were strong and he was happy to make me a conction to my liking when the cran vodka wasn't doing the job. Restrooms were clean, the prices were super cheap, and plenty of space to sit (granted it was empty). Will definitley be coming back.
author: Peggy A.

description:
Ok, so I get it. This place isn't for me. It's a scene, just like 330 Ritch and District are for us straight kiddies. I show up in my Sunday finery, and expect to get the evil eye from the gorgeous bouncer, the pretty bartenders, and anyone else with a penis who is not attracted to me. 

But I don't. 

Instead I get shown the digs, with a spot overlooking Noe and Market, and within seconds we're given strong as Ahhhnold margaritas. More people show up, and we get to see all the pretty gay men trickle in. I check. Damnit, yep, still a straight female. 

And then 3:00 pm hits. 

Wooo Britney Spears "Circus" release party! Bitches better recognize that my guilty pleasure has a new album out! We dance around and enjoy ourselves and order a delicious Thin barbeque pizza to coat our bellies. I watch my cutie-patootie gay roommate get his ish on with a hot lawyer from the Duboce triangle. 

I end up leaving at 4ish because hey, a girl's gotta get her swerve on in a place where gentlemen recognize her boobies and whatnot. At least I walked out with the phone number of a hot female Polish photographer who wants to take pictures of me. Notes on a Scandal FTW! 

Gah. It's 7:17 pm on a Sunday and I'm hungover from daydrinking extra strong margs from the Lookout. *Checking.* Yep, still a chick.
author: Devon S.

description:
My Vodka Redbull was the size of my face - GREAT value :) Went there and the place is just chill, the people are fun and who doesn't *love* the castro? Went there for a DJ battle... I imagined DJ's lined up next to each other and actually battling... if they were, that would've clenched a 5th star... alas, they just took turns. *sigh*

Great spot, regardless - good view, nice atmosphere, great for a chill night of drinking.
author: linda t.

description:
Great bar for people watching on Market St. whilst smoking a fag out on the veranda... hehe

Oh and there is a really cute and fun house DJ that spins on the weekends during happy hour. Christopher B. Eye candy with a side of funky house... does it get any better?
author: Tyler J.

description: I went tonight and had fun.  The staff is really friendly and awesome.  I met a couple Pinay lesbians, it was fun talking to them,  I like the outdoor balcony.  The DJ was good tonight.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
If they have Lesbian Night at this place, they should change the name to "The LickOut". 

Just sayin'.
author: Kiki G.

description:
I always have a good time at The LookOut! I went to meet some co-workers on Sat. The Look-Out played good music.. the bartenders are super nice and they make a delicious margarita... which is pretty surprising, not many places make good margies. 

2 Thumbs up for the LookOut!
author: Monica S.

description: It all depends on the crowd, but when you get burners, gays, great food, beats and cheap drinks. Well you know you are in for a fun night. It has a tiny dance floor, hence missing a star, and can have some very pretentious patrons. Yet usually it is very down to earth and not too over the top hot staff. The thin balcony is my favorite part. I love to be able to look out over Market St. Can't wait to go back and shake my tail feather!
author: Natasha M.

description:
If you're looking for a place to dance and be silly with your friends in the castro, this isn't the place to go. If you're looking to chill out, be seen, socialize, listen to music, people watch and is okay with big crowds then you should come here.

The Lookout was so full on a Saturday night that it was hard to get from point A to point B.  I came here with a bunch of friends.  I must say though that when it was Metro the crowd wasn't that great looking.   The crowd was definitely good looking (straight girl here lolz) and everyone was really friendly.  The DJ was pretty funny he danced and sang with me and played an array of good music.  Bathrooms were meh.  Only one bathroom for the gals which guys ended up using.  Drinks were good and the alcohol was plentiful.  I wouldn't mind coming back here again for the social scene.
author: Ro C.

description: It's sat and it's slow but the music is tolerable.   My faghags thought it was ok too, considering the bartender was hot (lest the no deodorant) and was nice.
author: J C.

description:
Wow, so during pride this year, some dude bought me a drink here from the other side of the bar. That has never happened before... and for that, this place will always have a special place in my heart.

But sigh, the dude looked like he just stepped out of the Liberace museum down in Vegas... you guys know what I'm talking about right? Whatever, I'm sure he had an amazing personality.

Anyway, this is a fun place full of the friendliest people San Francisco has to offer... It doesn't seem to get that packed like the other bars in the 'stro - Wait what? There's a pizza place connected to it? Wh-wh-what!! Amazing.
author: Richard T.

description:
This is one of the first bars I've ever been to in the Castro.  I know, right?  Ridiculous given that I've lived in the Bay for more than 4 years now.

A not-so-gaysian boy took me here to meet up with his fabulously amazing co-workers to celebrate the kick-off of Pride earlier this month.  FUN TIMES!.  For reals.

The bartender concocted some funky first drink for us both, not sweet, not yummy.  But we gave him a second chance and he poured out what has now become my new favorite drink...the creamy, the delectable, the downright sexual...choco martini.
Two things came to mind as I sipped (rather slurped) down my cocktail.
#1 - Chocolate...
(need I even elaborate?)
#2 - Alcohol + Chocolate...
(hot damn.  frisky.)

Honestly I'm still reeling from the drink.  We loved it so much, we decided to try making it at home and surprisingly it was almost just as good. 

AND, as the name suggests...there's plenty to LOOK at here.  I mean come on!  
Hot mens EVERYWHERE.  
It's a straight girls eye-candy land.
YumYum.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Decent gay bar at a good location. 

I'd give it 5-stars for the location and the patio (I don't smoke but enjoy looking out from it), but the long lines on many evenings, the cover charge, the "packed like sardines in a tin can" space, the UBER strong drinks (they make drinks at Ginger Trois and Trax taste like baby solution) and the spotty crowd give it a 3-star. But then again, I'm a fan of bars like Trax, The Pilsner, The Cinch, Ginger Trois, etc. so its just different tastes.

It attracts quite a clean cut, non-edgy, somewhat polished crowd of youngins many evenings, all dressed preppy casual. There seem to be numerous community based events and fund raisers going on, which is neat. The music is good albeit very loud at times and making your way through the bar on a crowded night can be an adventure. 

I used to frequent it a lot when it was The Metro and had the Chinese restaurant attached to it eons ago. Decent place to grab a drink but not a place I make an effort to head to regularly.
author: Amit S.

description:
The pizza here is amazing. I've been meaning to come back here again sometime for the food. Supposedly they have all you can eat pizza on Tuesday, so I'm definitely going to have to hit that one up. :)

The bar itself is really nice. You get a good view of Market St. and you can see all the colorful people walking around outside. They also have a DJ on the floor and they play video clips of random things on the flat panels on the walls. One time they were showing the Japanese anime Paprika o_O.

Oh, I do have to admit though, that sometimes this place gets super packed, which is annoying and tedious, one time I couldn't even get to the bathroom until I started body surfing on the crowd to get there *joke* but it would have been way faster I would imagine. I think it was Frat night or Boys night or something. So if you see anything advertising that, beware, unless you like your body constantly pressed up against some half naked boy and its so hot and sweaty you can barely breath. Well the first bit sounds nice :)
author: Xavier G.

description:
Never been here, but hear alright things about this place.  Attracts an older crowd, though.
Restaurant by day, gay bar by night. Woohoo!
author: Frankie W.

description:
Was so happy to find the pizza here!  Up until now, finding a good pizza always meant a hike to Gialina's or Arinells or, even farther, Amici's.  Now, a source in the Castro back-yard. 

Normally I'm a thin crust kinda guy, but with regard for consensus our group ordered the deep dish Castro Queen (a cornmeal-crust  pie, filled with lots of tangy chicken and spinach drenched in fresh & bright saucey goodness) and we all absolutely loved it.  The quality and taste of  the ingredients made this one vanish fast.  

It should be said to this is a great spot for people watching too, perched as it is above Market at Noe.  Really a fun spot.  And the food!!. . .I want to come back to try the other toppings too. . .

Already planning my return!
author: Mark N.

description:
Brits ahoy!

My partner had some of his friends from UNI (lol) over in SF, and last night we met up w/ them.  After trying to go to The Slanted Door, we picked our brains as to what else SF has to offer... um, gays that are in a really good mood?  Check.

We took Muni from the Embarcadero to Castro and these poor, poor Brits were greeted by a prayer circle of none other than the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, oy!  As one of said Limeys said, "When in Rome..."

We made our way to the LookOut, as I vaguely knew of the place from friends.  Now, we didn't go to the bar section (where a drag queen was conducting quiz night, oy again), but sat in the back with the smaller bar.  Not his fault, but I think the bartender/server/he-who-wears-tight-pants was a little overwhelmed... with five tables... yea.  Anyway we got our drinks quickly enough but the food took a REALLY long time.  Like, kind of excessively.  Maybe if he hadn't been texting behind the beer tap and gotten on the cook's ass (not literally, stop it...) a little more our food would have been there sooner.

When it did come, it was okay.  Gargantuan portions, as my British friends would comment upon.  The two burgers we ordered were good, if not a bit greasy.  The thin-crust pizza that was ordered was CRAZY greasy.  The cesar salad that was ordered looked uninspired.  However we had a great time, if it wasn't a bit hard to hear during the music interludes.

All in all a great night, but again slow service for less-than-stellar food.
author: James R.

description:
I'm sure people don't care to see that I update this place constantly.

But this place is a holder to street traffic. Last time I was trolling the Castro at night after the Sara Bareilles concert - my ex-co-worker who was in Miami was back.

We call him Blackout Cake - after a dessert we have at work.

And note to anyone, if you are blacking out by no means should you do it  on the balcony of this place.

I was worried for him. He would lean over to kiss me in that slight homosexual way that is exaggerated and I was hoping to not end up in some tragic roadkill on the sidewalk below.

Thank Madonna, I made it home from that experience okay.
author: Kim D.

description: Where to start, great location, cute boys, cute staff! Good food, happy hour on weekends and over all a great place to drink, catch up with friends and get your dance on because they play GREAT music here! The place is a gem in the Castro, its up the stairs and has 2 area's for private birthday parties and such. Clean bathrooms, a ton of outside space for overlooking the area and chatting with friends..this outside space has some bar stools and a long ledge for you to rest your drink on or any finger foods you have ordered on their happy hour menu. Inside is more bar seating from high tables and chairs...this place is casual yet border line nice-upscale ish.
author: Rose A.

description:
First of all, I really wanted to rate the pizza restaurant, called Thick 'n' Thin, but I can't find a separate company listing on here for it...  I see the pizza place and LookOut as totally separate.  It's all about the pizza.  And what a pie it is. 

We arrived at the top of the stairs to find an empty dining room.  Promptly greeted by the owner, Chris, who led us to a window table.  Great table, but the banquette bench on one side is significantly higher than the stool on the other.  We wondered if it's possible to lower the bench side; probably cheaper than replacing tables and stools.  

The glasses of red that we ordered were great.  The spinach salad was ho-hum, but the Caesar was delicious.  A creamy garlicky dressing evenly covered the evenly chopped romaine.  Note, I appreciate the even chop, while others prefer a rough tear or a classic, whole leaf.  The uniformity of the chop contrasted with the larger, rosemary-scented, focaccia croutons--homemade--and fresh-ground black pepper delivered a nice compliment to the garlic. One suggestion: toss those amazing croutons with the greens as you're dressing them!  Leave no crouton unturned!  

Crouton lovers: run, don't walk. 

Now, to the pie. 

We ordered the "Castro Queen" pie though we're now calling it the "Upper Market Bro."  I doubt many Castro queens are going to going to delight in the thick, crunchy-on-the-outside, soft-on-the-inside cornmeal crust topped with a layer of perfectly melted cheese and a tomato sauce that rivals any I've had.  Imagine Zachary's in Berkeley, but punch up the seasoning and flavor of each pizza component and you've got Thick 'n' Thin.  The sauce tastes so fresh, and cuts right through the richness of the cheese and denseness of the crust, leaving you wanting to take another bite before you've hardly chewed the one you're enjoying. 

I'm heading there with friends on Friday night, so I'll probably try the thin crust option, another Caesar, and I'll note the name and details of the wine I liked.  

Happy eating!
author: Jeremy D.

description: They have Woodford, but the crowd has become a little sad over the years.
author: Christopher L.

description: Went to meet a friend for Happy Hour. Ordered Absolute and Cranberry.....$6.50 for a drink that had no alcohol. My friend came in ordered the same thing.....$6.00. It's overpriced, no alcohol, and they didn't know how much to charge.....never going back. I would have given them one star, but I really liked the view.
author: Troy H.

description:
Glad to see the Lookout owners really making an effort to put in something worthwhile in this often-overlooked restaurant space. I've been a deep dish fan since my kiddie days visiting Chicago, and the bar in the Bay Area is set pretty high due to Zachary's and, more recently, Little Star.

While pizza is the main focus here, they do serve other items that go well with a place that's much more known for drinking than eating. Having said that, they do make a pretty decent pie. The cornmeal crust is executed quite nicely, giving a good crunch and solid base. Where this place fell short was in the other ingredients. The toppings were a little sparse, and the sauce was truly disappointing. What's always made an excellent deep dish pizza for me is the fresh, chunky tomato sauce that steams on top. What we got on our pie was too tangy, not very chunky, and altogether not that fresh tasting.

Having said that, if I am at the Lookout and got a serious deep dish craving, I probably wouldn't hesitate to order one. But if I have my heart set on truly outstanding stuff, I will probably go elsewhere.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Connected to The Lookout bar, this is the yet next iteration of the restaurant space above Squat and Gobble.  Chinese worked for awhile, a grill was - eh - not so much, but the pizza thing seems to have stuck.  And by gory, it's pretty darn good pizza.

The Italian Stallion is really good (had to ask if it was the server or the pizza, but it was the pizza), the pepperoni is tasty, the vegetarian all right, the spinach and feta good (but too HOT!), and the sausage - meh - I've had better.  But the deal of deals is that it's all you can eat pizza on Tuesday nights for $7.95.  Hello!  The servers just bring around pies and ask if you want the flavor they have in their hot little hands.  Easy.  Love it.

The Cyndi Lauper beverage (vodka, cran, red bull) is also tasty, but REALLY SWEET.
author: Evan G.

description: Owner is anti-lesbian! Owner physically pushed me over $2.00! Will never go back there again - he also grabbed my friends arm. There are better places to go for women and being a SF resident we will never go there again.
author: Maggie K.

description:
I love this space.  I always have.  Its one of my favorite perches for day drinking in all of the city.  Not a lot is changed from when it was Metro but something is different.  

Its amazing how much changing lights, a paint job, moving all the shit off the counters and putting in a lounge corner can do for the ambiance of a place.  My first time visiting The Lookout was in the evening and the darkness outside combined with the warm lighting inside provided a great ambiance and a feeling of class, something we all know is completely missing in the Castro.  The hot bartender provided something to look at behind the bar.

The place was dead and pretty much always looks dead from the outside and I count this as a plus.  I was able to take over a portion of the lounge seating to wait for my man and crew.  When they arrived we could actually hold a conversation and were able to get the attention of the hotness behind the bar every time we needed refills with no struggle.

I know there must still be some of the old Sunday Funday rowdiness goin on here since I see the guys dangling off the balcony on Sunday afternoons.  Someday I'll wander over and check it out.
author: Ian M.

description: It's hard to beat the "people" watching from the balcony.  They also play a great selection of music, though too loud for me on a bright afternoon.  Drinks are strong and usually good.  They always have some sort of drink special, which makes them pretty cheap.  The food is above average for bar food, especially the pizzas and burgers.
author: Kevin M.

description:
What used to be METRO transformed into THE LOOKOUT without my knowledge!!!  THAT IS HOW OUT OF THE LOOP I AM!!!  

Last night, I was dragged out of my domestic confines and obligated, by peer pressure, to drink and be merry at THE LOOKOUT.  What really surprised me is HOW MANY HOTTTTTT MENS there were on a SUNDAY AFTERNOON...Don't  y'all know that Sunday is a school night?

I had a great time mixin' and a mingling....BTW, there was not a cover and drinks were cheap...
author: Hiromi N.

description:
I went here and they said 1) all girl dj's and 2) $2 cover charge and 3) good dance music. (according to marketing material and posters I saw online).

Here's how it measured:

First, the dj wasn't a girl. Okay, they said all women dj's so I expect nothing less. However, it was a guy. No big deal, but thought I point it out.

Second, the cover charge was indeed $2 dollars and there was enough space to dance. There weren't a lot of people there (Thursday night on long weekend), but it was still a sizable crowd. For $2 dollars, it's still a good deal to listen to music and dance the night away.

Third, good dance music. I thought the music was pretty good. It's def. more dance, energy type music and less hip hop and R&B which I like anyways. Many Castro joints are similar in terms of music interest.

Fourth, I liked how even though it was women's night, they actually had a good blend between lgbt and straight and also men and women. it was nice to see that diversity and also in terms of ethnic background.

Fifth, it was very easy to find parking and since it's late at night it was free. I literally parked on sidewalk 1/2 block from it. It is also near residential so it's pretty easy (minus pride weekend) to find parking.

Sixth, for what it's worth, the bathroom wasn't that bad. Def. better and cleaner than the Cafe and some of the other clubs I've been to in the city.

Seventh, for smokers, they have a cool outdoor small patio ish area that extends on the trims of the building (2nd floor). It's nice to let the smokers do their thing and to have that separation versus at the Cafe it's a smoker's room, but right in the middle of the dance action.
A couple things on why I think it can be better:

1. Cheaper drinkers- no drink specials and it was $9 + tip for one. I don't mind, but they should do some specials last night.

2. It would have been nice if they served a little bit of food.

3. Would have been nice with more people.

Will def. go again because of the low entry price and decent music and will def. review it again on yelp.
author: Tina C.

description: So my *girlfriend* and I hit up The LookOut with some friends (some gay, some straight) on Pride weekend.  While there was a 30 min wait and a $10 cover, everyone coming out of the place was stumbling drunk so we figured that's where the party was at.. and we were right.  Awesome crowd, cool dance music (gay-friendly anthems) and amazingly cheap, stiff drinks can be found here.  One of my friends (who's straight) declared it one of his best nights out EVER.  Disappointingly, the outdoor balconies were filled with tons of people smoking so if you're not into that, just stick inside.
author: Toby C.

description: This is one of my favorite places to frequent in this beautiful city! Not only was it the first gay bar I went to, but it has amazing bar staff (always with a smile), great drinks, a tasty menu with great appetizers, talented djs on certain days of the week, and a location with a view that is to die for! I highly recommend popping in for an afternoon drink or partying it up any night of the week! Always friendly faces, and a great place to catch up with old friends. You'll probably see me here ~
author: Cornell M.

description: I LOVE the Lookout Karaoke Mondays! It is a great place to go have a pizza, a beer or something stronger and sing your guts out! There are a bunch of big screen TVs around the bar with the karaoke lyrics on them. The sound is not too loud, but the stage has monitors so you can really hear yourself sing. Members of the San Francisco Gay Men's Chorus often show up to sing so it is often like watching an episode of Glee. The karaoke host has an amazing selection of songs. This is a great karaoke night!
author: Paul d.

description: Best day is a Sunday afternoon (though it gets packed). Otherwise, not the funnest place unless you just want a drink with friends.
author: Phillip O.

description:
Thursdays are the only night I've gone to The Lookout, for the ladies night.

The Lookout is a nice bar with some seats for group socializing, and a great deck-type thing looking out over Market Street for fun people watching.  Thursday nights there is a DJ, and some people dance in front of the DJ booth, but I wouldn't label this a dance party or club, I would refer to it as a bar with music and optional dance space if the mood strikes ya. 

*Draft Bud Light... as lame as it sounds, I do enjoy it.
author: Sandy M.

description: This is such a great bar!!  The exterior seating with the lookout as the name professes already makes it a five star but it also has one of the coolest interiors I have encountered in my drinking days.  The bartenders are pretty friendly and the drinks are good.  Prices are better than what I'd expect at a place in this location that boasts such a cool view of Market.  Started out with some standard mixed drinks but have become hooked on the house beer which is aptly named Lookout Ale.  Great place!!
author: Sin F.

description:
I like going to Lookout on Sundays. Nice vibe, good energy, and good music.

Why the low review you ask? Service! Don't get me wrong, there are some great bartenders at this place. But there are also a decent amount of lackluster bartenders at this place. No energy. So unhappy to be there. If you don't like your job, then why are you still there.

This one bartender in particular, who I later found out is the "general manager" there, is the worse. He sits and talks to friends as if there isn't another soul in bar. And when he finally takes time out of his personal life to take my order he deliberately makes it wrong. On numerous occassions, I've asked him for a Kettle One and Soda, but what does he pour into my glass?? Well vodka!! and still has the nerve to charge me Kettle One price! Who does that? Does he not see me watching him make my drink? or does he just not care? And when I've confronted him in the past, he either pretends as if he did make it with Kettle One, or rolls his eyes before making me the correct drink. You would think the "general manager", I think his name is Gregg, would have a stronger work ethic than that.

It sucks to have numerous Sunday afternoons at Lookout spoiled by a few bad apples within the company.  I've been to numerous places in the Castro and always had pleasant experiences with staff, even when its busy and things can get stressful for bartenders. Take a note or two from Cafe, Trigger, and Q bar. I always have more than pleasant experiences at these places, no matter if there are 3 or 300 people inside. And never have any of those places attempted to cheat the customer by pouring me well vodka instead of the higher quality alcohol that I ordered. Shameful!
author: Armando M.

description: I only come here on Wednesdays...it's Drag Night!!! Probably one of the funnest experiences (assuming the good ladies are there that night)..the drinks are good, and whats great is the balcony that looks out on the Castro which makes smoking and drinking even better!! Great place!
author: Mig I.

description:
This place is THE place to be on softball Sundays or any other glorious summer day in the Castro.  Otherwise, it's just about average.  The pizza is good though!

I was more of regular there until Trigger opened.  Then I moved the party on down the street...
author: Jimmie L.

description: I like the Lookout! Nice staff, good drinks and they don't have attitude if you want to make up your own drink! And the outdoor LOOKOUT area is fun to watch the crazy intersection wondering if anyone will crash that day. You know what I'm talking about if you've been to the lookout. I never tried their food so can't judge on that.
author: Karen T.

description: Cute gay guys on the prowl. Mixed in with strong drinks (decent prices) and dance-y music and outside seated balcony for smoking. A fan.
author: Carmen S.

description: I kind of love this place, strong affordable drinks, friendly service, fun music and always great on a Sunday afternoon after an already crazy Saturday night.  My friends always throw their bday parties here in the side room, which I love because they have a separate bar for us to order food or drinks, a warm fire place if its one of those cold rainy SF days, and comfy places to sit.  I don't smoke but my friends who do love to be able to sit outside and Lookout at everyone as they are crossing market or castro.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
They have some of the best pizza around.  The Barbecue Chicken pizza is my favorite.  

Nachos are a bit salty, Quesadilla is awesome and hey, what happened to the RIBS! THEY WERE AWESOME!  BRING EM BACK! please ;)

Oh...  and the waiter with the blond hair is super cute...
author: Joseph L.

description:
one of the bars in the castro where you get the best view of what i call CASTRO CENTRAL. since they have an outdoor patio. you see one of the widest (and crazy) intersection in SF PLUS beautiful people walking up and down market. 

inside, there's various seating, as well. you get a fireplace and tables. DJ sets every night. i would definitely go every so often here.. most especially during summer. castro is very interesting during summer, and this place would be a good view point. 

$3 vodkas and what-not (happy hour) didn't disappoint me, at all. but i think i was too 'bougie' that one of the bartender have no idea what a 'slurpee' is. (FYI, it's a frozen cocktail!) ALSO, it's one of the bars that offers nibblers and pizza, to keep your stomach fueling (and tendency to get super hangover).
author: Marc K.

description:
Gus's Saturday night event, Social Club, is arguably the best gay weekly event in SF. Good looking crowd, and that's coming from a boy spoiled by the guys at LA bars.

One complaint: no matter what the weather is like outside, this place is always way too warm...I find myself staking out a place by the window.
author: Paul H.

description: We went on a sunday and it was pretty packed the drink service was great and also fast. however it was mostly alot of men. I think i counted a total including myself 7 ladies .lol
author: LoveMeTender t.

description:
Some of the best things about the Lookout are the people working there. I've befriended the staff and the bouncers, and they def make the experience! They have a great selection of liquor, have a food menu, and actually have their own privately brewed beer - something unique that not a lot of bars have; especially gay bars! The balcony makes for a great space to hang out on sunny Sundays, but can get smokey on busy nights - which are most nights of the week and weekend!
Cons - bathroom, as with most gay bars, is pretty gross - and sloooow. The backroom could be better utilized - seems to never get people back there.
author: Dustin D.

description: Went here for a drag event which was really fun! Everyone there was very nice and the bartenders kept em coming. I loved that they had a margarita bar where you can pour your own flavors. LOVED that. It had a nice view into the busy city and the balcony was probably the best part after one too many margaritas..
author: Diana L.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite locatins in the Castro. I love the outside balcony, especially on a nice weekend day. You can sit outside, sip your margarita and people watch on what's happening outside on the streets. You can probably see an almost near accident as this is the worst intersection in the City.

I've had many a party here and they've been great. New owners of late and they seem to be ok. Under lots of changes...not sure if I' like them all yet.

I love hanging out here on Sunday afternoons. It's lots of fun and a great crowd. The new Jock Sunday parties are lots of fun!

It's great to go to Lime Brunch beforehand and then off to Lookout!

I'll take a top-shelf margarita, no salt and a splash of grande marnier on top!  Thanks~
author: John S.

description: Decent little bar but a bit loud on the music. Not sure if it gets really busy or not.. So far, only been one time..
author: Rix G.

description:
Staff is incredibly warm and helpful. We have worked on a couple events together and its been nothing but smooth sailing.

Extremely professional.. AND good drinks and good food at thick and thin!

:-)
author: Art A.

description: This is a nice casual bar that's not divey, but not too at all fancy.  The drinks are good and there's always a lively crowd.  This isn't the most exciting place to go to, but it's fine if you go with a few buddies and you just want a calm evening out.
author: Ken G.

description:
It's more fun than a barrel of drag queens!

I was surprised at the percentage of women here, which got to be the majority as the night rolled on.  Mostly lesbian as I learned from a painful series of lost bets, but some bi and straight girls/guys throw in and feeling welcome.

Not much space to dance.  This is more a eat/drink/flirt/be merry type of place.  The balcony is entertaining for people watching; not to mention the periodic traffic near-collisions.  I didn't have to wait long for a drink, but maybe that's b/c I was fresh meat.  Speaking of the drinks, they were fairly strong.  Imagine that.
author: John H.

description:
I love to people watch. It's a hobby of mine. This place hosts one of the most fantastic people spots in the whole city.

The drinks were good. The bartender was friendly to me even though I am a girl and the place seemed to be full of gay men. 

My advice: Bring a jacket so you can sit outside. That's prime people watching country right there.
author: Adriane K.

description: It is so frustrating to me that this is the place my friends like to hang out these days.  Cool location, nice outdoor space, good music allow me to give this place two stars in lieu of zero considering the bartendars are absolutely terrible, inattentive, inorganized and frankly lucky they have ajob!!! The service is the worst of any bar anywhere I've ever been.  Go to the Lookout wtih friends and have a great time, but don't expect a quick drink or attentive bartenders (oh, btw, I don't drink so this isn't coming from someone needing 20 drinks a night)
author: Jason B.

description: I think this bar is average, the one thing that this place has "going," is the patio/balcony/ i don't know what to call it. But, even that area feels too small, and when people start coming in, you feel VERY clausterphobic. Other than that, its just  like any other bar. I think it would be better, if they did more to make themselves stand out. I didn't pay a cover charge to get in that day, but I hear they do a $2-$5 charge on spontaneous days?  Its NOT worth it. Also, it gets crowded pretty fast, and protecting your drink, while dodging rude people is not my idea of a fun night.
author: Gabriel T.

description:
I almost passed this place up and was very glad I didn't.  This is a great place to hang out and meet people.  The patio is way too small, but the window give the place a nice open feel.  The bar service is quick and friendly.  The awesome cowgirl lebian working the front door this past weekend was fun and set the mood for people coming and going.  

There isn't much attitude here, it is just a lot of people enjoying each other's company.  This seems to be a place people go with small groups, as opposed to some of my other favorite "drink to forget" or "drink to get laid" haunts.  The bathroom line can be a little long, but it moves quickly.
author: Ted G.

description:
OK, I'm so late to this game in updating my review, I guess that confirms my total unhipness and uncoolness.   

I rescind my former review and give it four snaps and a circle.

They definitely figured something was not right and fixed it.  Sunday afternoon's are the best here. Too bad everyday isn't Sunday...
author: Jim O.

description: Ok, I'm going to come right out and say that The Lookout is one of my favorite bars in SF. I'd always been intimidated to go inside being that I'm a girl and this place is known for hottie boys "looking over" the outdoor patio. However, Pride solved that for me. I honestly thought it would be skeezy inside, but boy was I wrong...um can I say super fun?? The music is beyond awesome, like Britney, Ke$ha, etc. The drinks are incredibly strong, so much so that my friend had to ask them to put more Ginger Ale in her next drink. There are way too many gorgeous guys wondering around inside, holy moly, and most of them were super friendly and fun! I also like the layout of the place and of course the infamous outdoor look out area. Especially on Pride when you can see all sorts of chaos going on below. I'm not sure what it's like normally, but during that occasion there was a huge mixture of guys and girls. I sooooo want to go back and try out all the other cool sounding nights/happy hour/food!!
author: Sonya D.

description:
I Think this place is great! The deep dish pizza is serious business. I have made my own by choosing my own toppings every time. AT LAST... a nice sit-down casual pizza joint in the Castro!
If only every pizza place had cute, friendly waiters!
author: Jimi G.

description:
Wow, it is sad how dead this place is. We went in last night at about 10:00pm and there were about 3 people in the place. The bartender was sitting at the bar with a newspaper because he had nothing to do. It is still a great space, and has all the ingreidents to succeed. They need to get some drink specials, some advertising, and most of all a SIGN. Hopefully the new owners can make a go of it.

UPDATE: Went here on Easter Sunday about 4:00pm and the place was hopping, cute boys and sisters of perpetual indulgence everywhere, I had given it two stars, but adding another two, I love that it is doing well again.
author: Dave O.

description: Rude... we went to lime. Nobody checks on you or asks if your food and drinks are ok. Mine was not...but nobody knew. I was going to have a corporate thing here...guess not. Rude ass bartenders
author: D R.

description:
k, so hands down FANTASTIC pizza in the CITY!  ;)  Loved both the deep dish and flat crust.  Great vegetarian options too...if you care.  ;)  
Been three times and the tastiness has been consistently GOOD.  Must try, more people should be.  CHEERS to THICK & THIN!
author: Jester Swink J.

description:
Just here to review the pizza, although the bar looked great....

I went based on the Tablehopper review, and was not disappointed.  In short, it's not as stupefyingly amazing as Little Star, but only by just a little bit.  Thus, it's really good.  And way better than Zachary's.  I had the thick crust Castro Queen and by all measures it was a solid pizza.  Crust was flavorful and not too doughy, fresh ingredients, and tangy sauce.  I will return, and maybe to the bar as well!
author: Marty F.

description: Not only is this one of my favorite gay bars, it is overall one of my favorite bars.  If it is a nice evening, the balcony makes a great place to have a conversation and people watch, the only problem is that for non-smokers, you may end up being surrounded by people smoking.  Overall, the drinks are decently priced (well, considering that all bars are way overpriced), the staff has always been friendly and good music.  My few times there I've never seen it too crowded, which I find nice.  I haven't tried any of the food there, only drinks in the evening.
author: Tony H.

description: Been there twice as a Peachy's Puff and gay men are sooo much more generous with tips, smiles, and happy good times than annoying drunk straight men hitting on you.  At least at closing time folks were dancing, not very many, on their tiny dancefloor the times I've been there.  I like the deck, but it was way too packed with smokers.
author: Cara J.

description: Five stars for the kindness, helpfulness, and great services from the staff, Eric and the Manager, Chris at the Lookout. I had my birthday party at the mezzanine and Eric was so helpful to get my party set up. He was quick and flawless.  Although he was busy at the restaurant, Eric still managed to take care of my needs. Great nibbles and drinks, too.  I wish I could give them more stars for their friendliness and flexibility to work with me on my schedule and requests. My guests had a great time and so did I. Love it love it and they sure know how to provide good service. Lookout has always been one of my favorite local bars to hang out with my friends. Now, Lookout is the first place that I would think of if my friends want to have drinks and hang out. Thanks again!!
author: Alex L.

description:
"look out! there's a hot bunch of boys sitting in the corner."
"look out! there's some tasty bar food coming your way."
"look out! the drinks are very strong."

i finally made it to my friend's new bar, THE LOOKOUT! the first time, i jumped the gun and he was carrying in supplies with a sign taped to the door asking for bartenders. whoops. 

it was worth the wait, let me tell you. i walked out of that joint all warm and fuzzy, well-lubricated, and grinning from ear to ear.
author: May T.

description: GREAT place to enjoy some late afternoon / early evening drinking with friends.  They need to rename it WatchOut though... cuz GURL!  There's something about the place - the drinks, the views, the balcony, the sunlight - that can keep ya there for a LONG time and gettin' ya PLENTY tipsy.
author: Chris G.

description: This is strictly a review of the pizza restaurant within the Lookout, Thick and Thin. The bar is fine, but don't leave without trying their pizza!  Not the best pizza I've ever had, but it's by far the best bar food I've ever had. The thin crust is surprisingly good. They saute their mushroom topping in garlic before putting it on the pizza -- a welcome change from the dried out mushrooms you sometimes get on other pizzas. Service is friendly and attentive too.
author: Wendy C.

description: Look-out for this place! (unless of course you like a cluster-fuck of crazy)
author: Chris C.

description:
hmm where to start 
good music
affordable drinks
not a very aggresive crowd
friendly atmosphere 
(i am straight)


bad 
i had to pay a $4 cover

will i go back i am sure ill be there again one day
author: Trent D.

description: I'm not a big fan of The LookOut, but I will say this, when I go, I do have a good time.  They do lack space for dancing, which is a pitfall, but they do have a balcony which I enjoy.  The drinks seem a bit pricier here for some reason, again not really sure why.  The DJs are hit and miss, but the last time I went they had someone who spun "Me and Myself" by Ben DJ and Sushy, which is my current favorite, so that was a major plus!  All-in-all not a shabby bar, but just not my usual first choice in clubs and bars to go to in Castro.
author: Brent A.

description: I have to admit I like the view from the Cafe a lot better than the Lookout.  Also, I'm not keen on the house version of every pop song being played at incredibly insane decibels.  Then again, I did have a great time for my friend's birthday.  It is very roomy and you can sit down and have a really loud chat (I mean, screaming at the person, practically).  Then again, you don't go to clubs and bars to have chats, huh?  Well, anyway, it's predominantly gay men sprinkled with a fair bit of straight girls in the crowd.  The bar staff is really nice too.  Overall, it was a good time with a bunch of friends.
author: Dorothy S.

description: great tasting pizza, I heart beefy and Jonathan, great mix of people and usually pretty busy.  The 'tending can be slow - other times painfully slow, but not bad enough to make me stay away.
author: Nick G.

description: The old Metro  is now called The Look Out. Same decor same crowd but new owners. Sunday afternoons are not to be missed if you are in the Castro. They pour well and they are proud to have Mr Gay San Francisco 2008  as one of their staff members. He is hot, adorable and dating my friend Ms Buss (yes the secret is out...sorry guys but you are so cute together that I have to tell the world) and he loves him some Bambi too...
author: Teddy d.

description: Avoid indie thursdays at all cost.  Not because of the indie music but rather the lack thereof.  Saw the advertisment and had my hopes up that this place will deliver some good indie music but instead they played pure dance pop with some colorful videos almost sounded like a continuous Aqua remix.  At one point they even played "get into the groove" by Madonna, I mean when was she indie??  I'm not trashing Madonna or what they played but please don't false advertise and then play dance music because if I wanted to hear Gaga, I would rather go to Badlands.  The closest it ever come to indie of MGMT, i guess.  People looked bored and left and the DJ tried to dance to bubblegum dance music and it was hella annoying......want to shake his head and say play something indie and stop dancing.  Wanted to relax and kick it with some indie stuff but complete waste of $2.  Never be back here again for the not so indie thursdays.  FYI, this place needs to google "indie bands" and get an idea who they are cuz what they played were anything but.
author: Jerek L.

description:
It's a sure sign when you go out and the first drink you order, the bar tender after giving you your grey goose and tonic asks if you're high on coke... to just call it a night.  

I was visiting SF this past weekend and was meeting a friend there, I got there sort of late, around 1:30AM on a Saturday night... was my first time.

How should I have taken that?  I was kind of shocked, and didn't really understand at first.  I don't do, or ever have done drugs.  hrm  wow and I still left a tip.  

I was dressed nice, hair was good.  My eyes were a little red from having really bad contact in all day.  hrm.

And I thought LA's gay scene was bad.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Service is pretty damn slow, and it wasn't even that crowded. And they do not know how to make a lot of drinks.  The bartender actually asked me how to make what i ordered.
author: Jeff L.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE..   This place is my new hang out place after brunch on Sundays in San Francisco.  The crowd is typically great and has been pretty fun the times I have been in town with friends! Great atmosphere!  LOVE IT!
author: Eric C.

description: Dude, I'm not gay, and this is my first experience at a real gay bar.  I had a great time.  I went with two girls just incase, and didn't stray too far from them, but overall I had a good time.  Drinks were reasonably priced, and the view was cool.  Everyone was friendly.  I couldn't tell if they were genuine or it's cause I was wearing cowboy boots, but I think I'd go there again, with a group of course.  Oh and I tell you one thing, most all gay guys are ripped!  It looked like venice beach in there.  Made me want to hit the gym.
author: Amir B.

description: This is an awesome place to start (and potentially end) your night. I made my way over here to celebrate a friend's birthday on Saturday and it was the perfect crowd. Not toooo crowded but plenty of eye candy and an awesome view. The bartenders there were really friendly and quick to serve and the prices weren't too bad. On a nice night, this would be a great place to go because of the patio. Extra points go to this place because I ended up with approx. 27 pictures on my camera of me and friends with a poster of a hot half-naked man behind us.
author: Lauren B.

description: I was here for happy hour / a trivia night a few months back with some friends and had a blast. The Lookout isn't my typical scene but it was a great place to sip on some cheap happy hour drinks and attempt to answer some trivia questions! Everyone here is really friendly and it's a fun, upbeat environment. I don't think I'd make a special trip out to the Castro just to go to this bar but I'd definitely stop in again if I were passing by!
author: Amanda R.

description: My hazy Sunday afternoon didn't really seem so different from my fuzzy Sunday afternoon experiences when this was the Metro.  And this is a good thing.
author: Marcus C.

description: It is fun to come on Sunday afternoons.  The drinks can be a bit pricey, but otherwise it is a lot of fun to enjoy the music and if you lucky enough, stand outside and overlook Market and Noe.
author: Michael H.

description: The last few times I've been to the LookOut I've had a blast.  Drinks are good for the most part - a few bartenders aren't spectacular, but when you find a good one definitely stick to him or her!  The people are on average more attractive than in the other SF gay bars/clubs.  The little balcony area is also nice to get a breath of fresh air and be able to watch the parade of crazies pass by beneath you on the street.  There is also a great little sitting area along the back wall if you need to rest your feet from a night of dancing.  I also generally like the music here.  The DJs play a fun mix of housed-up pop songs.  Love this place, definitely check it out!
author: Scottie M.

description: The Burger's and Pizzas are pretty tasty at Thick and Thin Pizza, but not really all that exciting.  Don't get me wrong, I eat here and like it, but I never leave thinking wow.  Service is friendly but amazingly slow.  Hopefully that is because everything is housemade?  Anyway I would give this place 4 stars if things improved slightly as it stands maybe a 3.5.
author: Michael D.

description:
Why can't the Castro ever get it right??  What a waste of an interesting space.  Big hopes with the ownership change to live up to its design potential.  Where's the imagination in a town as creative (hello...gay) as SF?   "Lookout", you might just find some inspiration from your name, the spectacular view and think about an appealing decor makeover that could attract both old and new clientele looking for something exciting and different (I dunno, retro airport lounge?? ski lodge?? internat'l spy hideaway?? space station??....anything but nothing.  just hire a decorator already!).  

For pete sake, at least get rid of those tired 'M" chairs.  Why do you think the new "Metro" left them behind?  And please take down that tacky paper sign...prove on the inside that you are new and have your own distinct identity.  

To end on a slightly brighter note, the exceptional pizza and tasty cocktails are worth a visit as you "lookout" onto the Castro Hills and fantasize about what could've been (and still could be with some money thrown at it) a uniquely warm, cozy and groovy (but ideally still unpretentious) place to perch and chill.
author: Don C.

description: I have dined here a few times and have ordered appetizers at the adjoining bar (the LookOut), but this was the first time I had a chance to try the "All You Can Eat Pizza Night" on Tuesdays for only $10. (You can still order from the regular menu if you'd prefer.) They have five pizzas coming out in rotation, like a pizza version of dim sum. Our night included 4 cheese pizza, ham & pineapple, tomato basil, BBQ chicken, and a sausage/pepperoni. The slices are a little smaller, making it easier to sample a lot, but I still can't believe I ate SEVEN slices (getting the BBQ chicken and 4 cheese twice). Each one was awesome. They also have a nice wine list plus a full bar.
author: Kevin G.

description: Had a fabulous time at trivia night last night, hosted by the inimitable Pollo del Mar and Bebe.  Bartenders were really friendly, the pizza from Thick 'n' Thin was incredible, and the space is great.  Love the wrap-around patio with the built in stools so it doesn't get too packed for the rail-riders.  Nothing better than a sunny weekend having post-brunch drinks and people-watching over the railing at your neighbors....
author: Lis W.

description: I'll be honest, I really miss the old Metro.  The Lookout just isn't the same.  Maybe it hasn't caught on yet, but each time I've been in, it's been dead.  The location ROCKS- with a great views of Market Street and all the queens walking to and fro-  so the lack of patrons is particularly surprising.  I'm going to hold off on a full fledged boycott of the space until the weather turns nicer.  With the outdoor balcony- it should pack them in when the sun returns to SF.  Fingers crossed, The Lookout space is my favorite in the city and beats Jet, Badlands and BoC hands down...
author: AJ L.

description: Went here for a few drinks on a Friday afternoon after experiencing my first 10 day week! Having come from Dallas, and not really being a "Castroite", nor someone who does the happy hour thing with any degree of regularity, I actually found this bar only "kinda okay", I mean, as bars go, it had cold beer, a somewhat attentive bartender, music and the usual S & M crowd holding court at the bar (in Dallas the S & M crowd is what we call the "Stand and Model" crowd).You know the types; pretty maids all in a row, but you say hi to them and they automatically shut down and go into their best Gloria Swanson pose and  their struggling!    Anyway, after having experienced the Bar on Church first, this place was a welcome respite. I managed to find seating out of the hustle and bustle and just sit and sip my drink and visit with my boyfriend. On a scale of 1 to 10, I give this joint about a 6
author: Michael D.

description: Fun, fun, fun! I love the little balcony Lookout, as well as the oval bar. The clientele are a great crowd - always friendly and fun. Definitely a good spot to spend a Thursday or Friday night!
author: Michelle G.

description: What the heck happened to the Metro?! This place still has the same tired old queens holding court. Back in the day, it used to be a fun place with an awesome Chinese restaurant. Now it's just another lame bar on Market St.
author: Frank R.

description: I'm a HUGE fan of deep dish pizza and LookOut's got some of the best. Not only are the toppings top notch, but the corn meal crust (at least that's what I think it is) is divine!!! And I love that you can customize it just the way you like. The thin crust pies are pretty awesome as well. Plus they've got yummy fried goodies, sandwiches, etc. You really can't go wrong here. They used to serve a kick-a$$ dessert pizza a while back...graham cracker crust topped with marshmallows and chocolate, aka smore's pizza. it was TO DIE FOR. Would love to see it again...maybe at least as a holiday special :-)
author: Gregory G.

description: I'd be happy to update this review later as it looks like my experience is not the norm, but my friend and I came in here, sat down at the bar for several minutes and were summarily ignored. It wasn't busy at all and the bar tender made no effort to say he would be right with us. In fact, he left the bar area before speaking a word to us! This is when we left.
author: Stu M.

description:
1 Star for the location
(I love that it's on the Church-Castro route)
1 Star for the drinks
(tasty drinks from pretty bartenders)
1 star for the music 
(never seem to be bad rotaions when I'm there)

It loses points for the drink prices and unattractive and mediocre queers...no offense I love queers (:
Also the fact that Ladies Night which is on Thursday costs money yet have no drink specials for the ladies..bad move
author: ebony p.

description: Nice gay bar in the Castro.  I went there on a hetero date and we were welcomed like one of the family.
author: Shawn H.

description: I struggled with what to rate this one.  The bar itself does a lot of great events for the community.  It has affordable drinks as well.  But MY GOSH!  It's 100 degrees in that place ALL THE TIME!  And the lack of coat check is just not very nice if they are going to have it that hot in there.  Other then that the bar is great!
author: Nichole V.

description:
I feel terrible writing a mediocre review for this place, since I LOVE the location and think the owners are great guys. I have tried time and again to enjoy this place and I just can't. 
What are the two biggest gay sins? Being boring and pouring weak drinks. By that criterion this place is sin-city. Cheap happy hours abound all over the Castro where you can get your drink on at reasonable prices, but not here. If I wanted cocktails filled with ice and juice I would go to a straight bar. Eeew! All that cranberry makes me bloat. 
Also, the bar in the center of the space is the most ridiculous waste of space. It needs to be tucked back against the windowless wall at the back so that barbacks can directly access supplies without having to plow through the crowd. One big open space that opens onto the balconies would make this venue much more interesting for drag shows and fundraisers. As it is now this place looks like it was designed as a neighborhood pub where you sit at a table with your friends, but that's not how they are using the space.

Fix it and I will give you more stars!
author: J D.

description: Thursday nights are now ladies nite, a mix of the castro usual hip hop/house/dance/pop stuff that's always in just about every place in castro. The women who run it are very friendly, and you'll find lots of ladies who don't want to go to mecca, or who have come here after (as mecca closes early). This is the new spot for thursday nites for women (unless it's a 3rd thursday cuz thats drift nite!) Ps ok ive been twice... i dont go out to bars too often.
author: Merredith L.

description: I have been to this bar twice and both times only stayed for one drink.  They have nice drinks and good bartenders...I guess I just have a hard time staying at a place that seems so cold.  I think there is a lot of potential and maybe trying some drink special nights (I am not aware of them having any) would help.  Also I would recommend getting rid of the stools with the "M" on the back., having the old Metro chairs doesn't help create a new image.
author: Johnnie T.

description:
two words:  TRANNY TRIVIA!  

Love it!  I had such a blast here!  I could see all the handsome gay men around the bar eyeing me and my girlfriends wondering why we'd invade their turf.  But, they knew.  We were there to WIN!  I laughed me ass off and even trash talked a gay porn star in the house!  Walked away with a tshirt, a buzz, and plenty of great memories for my efforts!

Yummy tomato/basil and quattro fromaggio (sp?) pizzas.  Pass on the sweet potato fries.
author: Susan L.

description: The lookout is a cool place to hangout at on Sunday afternoon.  Ive been here on Friday and Saturday nights and it can get uncomfortably crowded ESPECIALLY Saturday nights.  Theres no room to walk around sometimes.  The drinks werent that bad not the strongest but fair enough.  I definitely prefer this place on a sat or sun afternoon though.
author: Victor M.

description: The fried mushrooms were amazing.. or maybe I only thought they were amazing because I had 3 awesome cocktails? No, the mushrooms were incredible. I came here on a Tuesday evening. My friends and I were able to sit on the outside that overlooked Market St which was refreshing. Everyone we talked to was hilarious and extremely nice. I'll be back!
author: Ella C.

description: The bartenders are nice, the cocktails are decent enough...oh, and the view helps. This bars' best attribute is it's view. Many potential car accidents await (corner of Market & Duboce). Other than this, it like any other bar in The City.
author: Gabe T.

description: Came here on Sunday night (*night* for Sunday, late afternoon for other days), had some nice epiphanies (*epiphanies* for Sunday, happy buzzed thoughts-n-chats for other days).  One... gay bars may be the new hot spot for straight guys to meet straight girls.  Two... yelp parties have lots in common with my favorite things about gay bars.  Three... grey goose sounds a lot like gay goose when yelled over large crowds and music.  ...A few more i've forgotten.  But anyways this is a fun place Sunday night.  Ambiance - loud typical house music with a DJ, crazy video of army men and the little boys wrestling in a field, crowded and hot (at least on a sunny Sunday *night*), lots of men of course, drinks with liquor on the heavy side of course, balcony, large bar in the middle.  It was the crowd and vibe that made it fun.
author: Today Y.

description: My eye muscles got cramps from checking out all the cute guys that flock to this place on Sunday afternoons. 'nuff said!
author: Charles U.

description: I would say Look-out! if you are paying with a card.. I know better though.. right?  always carry cash.. If I actually drank as many drinks as I payed for, I would have left there in a f#@king ambulance. I can over look paying for a few extra drinks, but after the bartender kept giving me other peoples cards I could tell that they don't really give a crap about their job.
author: Jonathan L.

description: This is a fun place with average drinks at average prices. It just gets ridiculously crowded and hot to the point that you can't even manage to order a drink and have to push your way out to have a smoke. And as far as the long ass line to the restroom, you are better off exiting the venue and finding somewhere else to pee. If you want a crowded space this place can be really fun- if not, then pass.
author: Derek H.

description: I was pretty excited to try this spot ...but unfortunatley the pizza was pretty bad.  Maybe if you were super drunk from a night at the Lookout - the pizza would be a bit tastier.  If you are going for just the pizza,... I'd skip it.
author: erica g.

description: Though usually a fun bar to hang out at - easy bar access, neighborhoody environment when it's not crowded, and great views - going here on a Saturday night is a bad idea.  A $4 cover charge (highest in the Castro) and a bar too crowded to get a drink from makes for a one star review.
author: William C.

description: Excellent salads, attentive, friendly service and very good pizza. Terrific crusts for both the deep dish style and the thin. Good selection of wines by the glass and a full bar to boot!  A relatively small spot, convenient to transportation. The view across Market Street makes for great people watching!
author: Larry B.

description:
As far as pizza goes, this is some of the best in the city - MEGADELICIOUS!!!!

Thick and Thin has managed to develop tasty offerings in both the thin and thick crust variety.  If you are looking for a small snack with your friends as you enjoy HH (happy hour), go for the thin crust - The BBQ Chicken is way better than anything you'll get at CPK.  If you are going for the gold and need to load up, hit up the thick crust.  All the pizzas that they regularly make are good, but you can also make your own and it always comes out delectable!  

The recent remodeling has created a more enjoyable restaurant experience and the location just doesn't get better!  

Can't wait to hit up the all-you-can-eat!!!

xoxo
author: David M.

description: Seriously, I'm not ageist whatsoever. Line my friends up and you'll notice diversity not only in age, but also gender, persuasion, race, and attractiveness. Well, actually, you'd better scratch that last one -- all of my friends ARE hot. That said, I used to love this bar for its quietly rowdy atmosphere and wrap-around deck for supreme people-watching on the 36 or so streets that all intersect just below. However, somehow it has morphed into official "twink central" of late, where approximately 6,000 pretty children with IDs now congregate, trying to out-shout one another over the constant mind-numbing thump of the sound system. I am seriously glad for the owners that the business is thriving, but they've definitely lost a former loyal along with this shift; not that said patrons nor staff would care much, given I no longer fit their demographic. And yeah, I know I'm not THAT old, but the only way I think I could enjoy this bar again would be via time machine. Either back to when it was still the Metro or I was 22 ... take your pick.
author: Gregor G.

description: next we went to lookout and it was ladies night. i didn't get hit on which bummed me out but o well. the bathroom was tiny and even in a gay bar there was a long line for the ladies room. i wasn't a fan really of the music since i wanted to dance more and it was mostly 80's but whatever i shook it on the platform and made a few dollas.
author: Angelina M.

description: Ughhhh, god is this really the "hot" spot of the castro?  How sad. This place is without a doubt the worst bar setting EVER! Its like a big circle of death. Due to the "round"  layout, its horrible if you want to have a conversation with more than 1 person at a time. You can try to move to another spot, go this way, go that way, but your always stuck in the same position. This is the nightmare of the "lookdown"! The people are usually waayyy to drunk off there ass, which I don't understand because its like near DAMN IMPOSSIBLE to get a damn drink in this place anyway. So this is what goes down... You wait, and wait, and wait, and wait, and wait  while the short fugly drunk asian with the cowboy hat sneaks up in front of you and suddenly your now pushed to the back of the line. WTF? Where does the damn line start anyway?? Ok, so now its 36hrs later and I finally have my drink. Now to find my friends I must move through the uber gay sea of 45yr old men that feel the need to wear tight Hollister clothing while swinging there drunk old arms up in the air and spilling my drink allllll over me. Ok, seriously, this is a fricking crowded place, keep the old queeny gay arm movements to a minimum please!! So now that my drink is 3/4 gone from the spillage, shirt and shoes wet, I move through the "rotunda nightmare" and spot my friends on the outside deck. I think to myself I can make it. or can I? F"ck that! Forget it!  The wrap around patio is the saddest, most useless area EVER put in any bar!  It packs you in single file like an elementary school fire drill! Plus, by the time I even make it to the patio door, my drink will be gone, clothes drenched from my spilt drink, nose irritation from the permeating stench of the sweat from the 45yr old Hollitser wearing priss man, deaf from the loud blood curdling screaming voice of the fugly drunk asian with the cowboy hat....... eventually leading to my untimely death. The circle of death.....stay away at all costs!
author: B B.

description: My first gay bar! I loved this place and I think it loved me back. The vibe was all laid back and no one even threw shade at my husband and I for being breeders! The bartender was crafty (making up pretty cool drinks on the spot) and the garlic fries were nummy!
author: Shaunte L.

description: Don't worry-- you aren't going to be eating dinner in a bar. And don't' worry, you're not gay if you eat here. Technically both rooms are under the same name, "The Lookout," but don't let the loads of hunky men in the bar area scare you off. The two rooms (restaurant and bar) are joined by a hallway and platform, with an amazing floor-to-ceiling window where you can sit and watch all the action on the streets below. I've eaten here a few times now and the restaurant side is relatively dead considering the often large, fun crowds at the bar next door. In fact, on a Monday night, we were the only customers dining here. All the better! A quite place to gather with friends and sip cold beers, sink my teeth into salty kalamata olives and garlic-marinated mushroom pizza and enjoy endless people-watching. The service is consistently excellent and all kinds of people are welcome here, despite the prime location in the seemingly exclusive Castro scene. The pizza and views are far better than what you'll find at the other pizza options in the neighborhood (Cybelle's Pizza, Capri Pizza, etc.)
author: Stumbalina b.

description: Guys....c'mon! The only day that the "eat as much as you can" is on Tuesday....but actually it doesn't work this way! Such a looooooooong waiting for a pizza slice or the next pizza to come. By the time it comes weare either zzzzzzz sleeping on the chair or no longer wanting to eat the pizza! I know it is a STRATEGY to make more profits leting people eat less pizza, so why bother saying that it is a "eat as much as you can"??? Why bother? It makes us believe we are being cheated on! This is not nice at all! Either drop the night "deal" or just serve pizza like the Goats Hill Pizza place on Potrero Hill does! That is "serving pizza" as much as you can eat! Otherwise it is just false publicity and scamming customers! Not us anymore!
author: karl g.

description: food is good, drinks are strong, I used to go to badlands but it has become all bridge and tunnel so the lookout is the new it bar, they take credit cards and serve food. can I live there?
author: Nicholas E.

description: Maybe Its cus i'm not a gay guy.  I may come across verbally abusive in this review because I feel like I'd been mistreated at this particular place.  First off the bartenders in this place are somewhat ok but for the most part suck ass (maybe they do?).  They don't acknowledge you unless you're a good looking person or something cuz they didn't even see me or my girlfriend for that matter.  They dont serve pitchers and they don't like to joke with the customer in any way, shape or form.  The music was good cuz it was techno, but if I hafto hear another lil wayne or rhianna song again on the radio I'm gonna kill someone. (My ears have feelings too! ESPECIALLY AT WORK WHEN IT'S THE SAME SONG ON AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN...i recently put it on the spanish station because of it...thanks lil wayne..thanks rhianna..for making me learn spanish!)  it's not because it's rap, because I am a huge rap fan..big pun, cuban link, biggie, big l, nas, jay-z's kinda whack now but still better than lil greesy and marijuana-rhianna.  anyway back to the review.  basically this was my second time in the gay district (you can read my review on sparky's diner if you think i hate gays..) and it was the most dry and arrogant surroundings ever.  there were two girls who kissed which was pretty cool.  that doesnt' happen too often.  but look..the definition of a bar is a place to go to let it out and have a good time.  I was not able to let it out and I didn't have a good time.  I'm never going to a gay bar again.  Thanks you homosexuals...you've ruined gay bars for me forever.  For all of you planning to goto this bar, make sure you're not straight and make sure you're dry and arrogant because thats what you'll expect to see here.  this place gets 10 to the 100th power thumbs down.
author: Jack N.

description: I stumbled upon this place while meeting some friends for drinks at the Look Out next door. I am SO happy that I decided to try their pizza instead of sticking with my normal bar meal of nachos (I fell back into old habits on another visit and they are also delicious) It was the BEST pizza I've had since leaving Chicago. The only bad part is having to decide between the super yummy thin crust or the equally good thick crust. I would recommend going with a large enough group so you can order both =). All the ingredients taste fresh, especially the tomato sauce, which has a great flavor and has real chunks of tomatoes. The best part is there are so many options - perfect for me, who is notorious for placing difficult orders and customizing everything.
author: Julia B.

description: Delicious deep dish pizza with a martini. What other pizzeriza has a full bar?!
author: Paul R.

description: The hardest part of leaving my apartment in Hayes Valley was sacrificing proximity to Patxi's pizza.  Thank goddess, good pizza has made it's way to the Castro!  Enough with greasy slices on paper plates; this is the real thing.  Deep dish (I had the chicken club last night....delicious!) pizza covered in lots of sauce.  The magic is in the sauce for me; I'm one of those "easy on the cheese--heavy on the sauce" kind of guys.  Many pizza sauces are too sweet for me, though.  This one is a little spicy and super yummy.  That said, I was surprised to find that the thin crust pizza is even better than the chicago style.  And then there's the s'more pizza...do not attempt to eat it alone.  So they've got the food down pat, but the bar's gin selection is anemic.  Can't a guy get a top-shelf gin in the castro?  Perhaps some of the other neighborhood bars have a better selection; I wouldn't know, I usually make a u-turn about 5 paces past the doorman.  The Lookout is spacious, equipped with a wrap-around smokers balcony, and staffed by a collection of heavy-handed, sexy bartenders.  We were able to gather a group of 12-15 friends comfortably, without stepping on each other's toes all night.
author: Major M.

description: We went there early on a Tuesday afternoon and had a great time.  The thin crust Quatro Formaggio pizza was awesome, our cocktails were super, and it's not too expensive.  Great place to relax and people watch.
author: Katherine G.

description: I wanted to buy a co-worker a thank you meal and he really wanted to go here.  After eating the pizza, I can see why.  I love pizza and will definitely be making a return visit, maybe as one of the places on my birthday.   If they start having root beer as one of the sodas, they'll get another star.
author: Cornelius M.

description: Plenty of hot guys here but there should be a requirement that they take their shirts off.
author: pauline e.

description: I'm an East Coaster who loves to hate on California pizza.  But these guys (who are also awfully cute!) got something worth checking out.  I've now had both the thin crust and the deep dish versions, both delicious.  And watch out for the nachos - chips are made fresh which makes them impossible to pass up.  The Lookout is a great spot to meet up with a crowd of friends for drinks and snacks.  Great location, fantastic balcony.
author: D J.

description: The Lookout is a great neighborhood spot. The staff is nice and not pretentious. And yes the guys are hot. But what about the pizza, people???  That's why I go. : ) Okay, and beers on the balcony too.
author: nicole e.

description: had dinner at the lookout last night.  definitely a surprise at the quality of the thin crust chicken pesto pizza.  really fantastic, plus it's a great bar with one of the finest views in the city.  the balcony here is one-of-a-kind, come for drinks, come for food, you won't be disappointed.  plus, it seems to be much more mixed than the rest of the castro bars, which this city needs much more of!
author: Brent H.

description: The new pizza restaurant is the best addition to the Lookout bar. Prepared with hearty yeast crust and garden fresh ingredients, pizza is upgraded to casual gourmet without being pretentious. Comes in personal size portions that are still ample enough to share with someone else if you're looking for a tasty tummy-satisfying appetizer. I definitely recommend the 4 cheese pizza where you can actually taste the uniquely fresh flavors of all 4 cheeses. A great blend of subtle salty, sharp and tangy flavors. Would also love to see this particular pizza complemented with a honey wheat crust. Cute and very friendly bartenders make it a nice place to just have some lowkey cocktails with friends and enjoy the food. They've been developing some unique signature drinks which are worth trying too. Hopefully with some warmer redecorating down the road, they'll make the Lookout a cozier and more fun place to spend a social evening or kickback weekend afternoon.
author: Tom A.
